Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site. Work personas Work personas are categories that are assigned to employees depending on the nature of their work. Employees will fall into one of three categories: Remote, Flexible or Required in Office. Required in Office A required in office work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office. This persona is required to work from their assigned workplace location 100% of the work week based on the business needs of their role. Flexible A flexible work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office and will work from their assigned workplace location roughly 3 days/week or less (generally around 40-60% of the work week). Flexible employees may choose to work the remaining working time from their workplace location or home. Flexible employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment. Remote A remote work persona is defined as an employee who performs their responsibilities exclusively outside of a ServiceNow workplace and is not contracted or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office, including those whose place of work (pursuant to their terms and conditions of employment) is their home. Remote employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment.

We are looking for an Associate to: Lead project teams of architects / landscape architects / designers within a landscape architectural studio Manage the quality of landscape architectural work Develop the people in the teams Manage the given resource and execute financial control over project design budgets Manage contractors and sub-consultants engaged to co-deliver the firm’s projects Actively participate in the firm’s strategic planning (Singapore and global) as well as project planning Develop client relationships and actively participate in the firm’s marketing and business development processes Produce concepts and schematic designs in accordance to clients’ requirements and aspirations for their projects Develop detailed design and produce detailed drawings and specifications for tender and for contractors to follow for construction purposes Manage the construction and implementation of projects You and your competencies Degree in Architecture/ Landscape Architecture Minimum eight years of architectural/ landscape architectural/ urban planning practice Leadership qualities with strong general and project management skills Ability to manage a small team of approximately six professional team members Outstanding portfolio of work with good design capability and creativeness A flair for design and good knowledge of global projects Conversant with construction practices Proficiency in AutoCAD, REVIT, 3D visualization programs like Rhino and Adobe, Microsoft Office and other commonly used software applications Welcome to our Architecture & Landscape Division Our Architecture and Landscape team at Ramboll is made up of creative and passionate landscape architects, with a shrewd insight into the blue-green footprint on public spaces in Singapore. With the benefit of Singaporean Citizens’ improved quality of life at the forefront of their priorities, we believe that blue-green solutions should not only be human-scaled, but also contribute to urban life, to educate and inspire, improve our water quality, and ultimate serve as a functional and vital role in enhancing the social experience of our spaces. This is created by marrying our tried-and-tested processes with international standards of design – from conceptualisation to implementation. Ramboll in Middle East, Asia Pacific and Africa Ramboll has more than 1,900 experts working across 17 offices in the Middle East, Asia Pacific and Africa. We are present in UAE, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, China, India, Singapore, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Indonesia, Myanmar, Australia, New Zealand and South Africa. Our experts are applying their passion to deliver innovative solutions in markets as diverse as Buildings, Transport, Water, Environment & Health, Energy and Architecture, Landscape & Urbanism. Founded in Denmark, Ramboll is a people company. We invite you to contribute to a sustainable future working in an open, collaborative and empowering culture. How to apply Apply online. Attach your CV, cover letter and relevant documents showcasing why you are the right fit for the role, and when you are available to start. We look forward to receiving your application.

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission. In Consumer Channel Sales & Marketing (CCSM) our purpose is to create value with our partners, to market and sell innovative consumer solutions powered by Windows, Office, Surface, and Xbox. We’re positioned right at the intersection of customers, hardware partners, and channel partners. Our team works with ecosystem partners and internal business groups to drive digital excellence and e-commerce capability, as well as accelerate cloud and subscription adoption. Together, we win by delivering compelling at-home and on-the-go experiences combining intelligent edge devices and services that create Microsoft fans for life. As a member of our team you’ll be part of growing a multi-billion-dollar business, charting new areas of innovation and impacting billions of lives around the world. You also will be a part of a culture centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, If that appeals to you, it’s an exciting time to be here in CCSM. We are seeking a Marketing Planning Lead to join the Asia Regional Consumer Channel & Partner Marketing (CCPM) team. This role is responsible for effective and strategic marketing planning for Asia region and to support sub regional teams to drive a strong marketing framework and plan a modern marketing mix that attracts relevant consumer audiences and drives conversion at point of purchase. The purpose of the role is to maximize and plan marketing investments that deliver best-in-class, effective marketing and maximise ROI. The Marketing Planning Lead has the responsibility of acting as the trusted advisor for the sub regional teams and partners, of measuring and improving partner marketing capability, owning Asia level research requirements, ensuring insights are used, sharing best practices and enabling marketing innovation with tools & new solutions. In this role, you’ll be responsible for supporting sub regions to planning of compelling seasonal and One Microsoft marketing campaigns, with focus on driving digital excellence and omnichannel innovation across channels and thru partners, you’ll look for opportunities to share best practice and maximize consumer marketing vehicles which include digital sales motions, in-store physical environments like shop-in-shop programs, partner readiness teams who evangelize our products with consumers and retail sellers, and by driving local thru-partner campaigns efforts to support product launches and key seasonal beats. You will own the partner marketing playbook in the region and drive a partner marketing V team to ensure best practice is shared and marketing innovation is maximized with our partners. Working with a cross-functional Marketing Council, you will support the Asia sub-regions to plan full-funnel seasonal marketing campaigns. You’ll be responsible for spend management in the region, working closely with the finance team and you will also work with BSO team to evaluate campaign spend allocation and marketing effectiveness. You will act as the central point of contact in Asia to drive campaign tools & processes, partner marketing workshops and develop the over arching marketing calendar. With a cross-partner, cross region view, you’ll help the sub regional marketing teams drive partner capability assessments which then will drive specific partner recommendations and transformation initiatives. You will act as a champion of our brand in everything that you do, working as part of the team to ensure that campaigns align to the larger Microsoft brand proposition, thinking globally while acting locally. You’ll drive impact by leveraging data and insights in order to create more targeted consumer and partner experiences to maximize ROI. By joining the Asia CCPM team, you’ll collaborate closely with regional product category, sales teams , integrated marketing, business operations and the CCPM teams locally to plan full-funnel marketing for an exciting ecosystem that continues to grow. As part of the regional team, you’ll have the opportunity to share learnings and best practices with other regions as well as leverage the WW infrastructure for support and shared platforms. You’ll act as the central point for Asia marketing operations functions, working across teams to drive workflow efficiencies, optimize tools/platforms and simplify decision making. You will possess the creativity to lead the evolution of our strategy as well as the skills to create and sustain brand consistency and operational excellence. You will act as the voice of Asia back to the World Wide ( WW) teams to ensure campaigns and assets are planned in line with Asia seasonal beats and to capitalize on the market opportunity. Responsibilities Whilst this is an Individual contributor ( IC) role, it is also a leadership role, you will need to demonstrate strong leadership and influencing skills through the leadership of V teams across the region. Working in a matrixed and global environment, you can influence and manage across functions, partners and teams to drive growth & transformation. You will also be someone who is passionate about inclusivity, supporting diverse teams and inspired by collaborating with high performing, multi cultural, sales, category, and marketing teams Lead, influence and support the planning of full-funnel marketing, across Asia and the Sub-regions ( Japan, SEA, KR, IN and ANZ) and across consumer products and channels to drive profitable sell-through and build brand advocacy. This role is accountable for supporting and building efficient campaign operations across the region, ensuring that investments drive maximum ROI across all parts of the marketing mix. (30%) Strategic Marketing Planning Work with Sub-Region and regional marketing teams, and functional partners such as media planning and integrated marketing to plan full-funnel seasonal marketing, including consideration for retail partner capabilities and opportunities Ensure that multiple funding models are planned and leveraged, in order to build efficient, compelling campaigns & programs. Own annual and seasonal investment planning and spend management. Responsible for the utilization of spend financial tracking tools ( FMT/MPP) and processes across the region ( working with finance, Businss Operations and Product/Category leads) Work across category, sales & marketing operations teams to maximize investments and synergy across tactics. Own marketing ROI modelling Lead the Regional Marketing council to develop and plan investment allocation and activity planning in line with all seasonal beats and annual planning cycles including all marketing functions. Identify and create cross-line of business campaign opportunities & concepts. Take any budget asks to WW budget owners. Drive a modern marketing mix that focuses on omnichannel innovation, that provides consistency at all touch points, a seamless consumer experience and that maximizes ROI for investments Own the CCPM input to the seasonal planning process and meetings for Asia region – working closing with the sub regional team and functional leads Work across Modern Life and Gaming marketing teams to look for synergies and collaboration opportunities. (25%) Partner Centricity & Relationship-building : Drive marketing capability assessments across the Sub regions’s,and facilitate the local teams to understand strengths and opportunities to help target & refine campaigns, and to work with partners to improve their capabilities. Build and drive process to measure the impact ( working in conjunction with the Asia Digital lead) Act as a trusted advisor and thought leader to the SR teams to help support local partner marketing planning, using data and case studies to help to build credibility and influence to help land key priorities or innovation. Facilitate best practice sharing across the region. Own Retail Partner Marketing Playbook for Asia – focus on improvement of processes and increasing partner marketing capabilities across the partner marketing teams. Collaborate and drive co-marketing planning across the region that involve silicon and OEM partners. Look for new marketing innovation/partnerships we can bring to partners. (20%) Execution Excellence : Manage spend & investment strategies, evaluating campaign effectiveness and impact accross all elements of the marketing funnel. Work with sub regions to deliver consistency for the consumer journey across all touchpoints. Maintain a holistic view and influence changes when needed. Deliver against timelines, budgets, and scorecards while also capitalizing on innovation opportunities. Act as point of contact for Marketing Operations, and BSO team, partnering with worldwide teams on optimizing processes, tools & workflow Ensure brand consistency and deep understanding of the customer, competitive and marketing landscape across marketing executions Proficient across Microsoft programs, platforms and tools. Role model a culture of integrity and compliance, where trust and transparency are core to all decisions (25%) Actionable Analytics and Insights : Analyze campaign performance results against execution activities to identify causals, opportunities and action plans Own the cadence and cascade of end of campaign reporting. Drive targeted consumer & retail research initiatives and take responsibility for ensuring insights are utilized. Manage cascade of all data to the SR. Understand the digital and physical buying journey (omni channel), well-versed in sales channels, commerce platforms. Expertise landing and coordinating cross-discipline marketing programs and sales programs. Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us build our culture and achieve our mission. The Device Partner Sales (DPS) team plays a critical role in achieving this mission. We build, market and sell intelligent edge and intelligent cloud devices and solutions with partners, including OEMs, device distribution channels, original design manufacturers, and Silicon providers. We work closely with our device ecosystem and internal business groups to build devices that consume our cloud, innovate with device partners, and transform how we sell devices and services with partners. Opportunities in DPS are expansive because we span the entire product lifecycle -- from incubation, prototyping, and portfolio planning to the design-in, sell-in, and sell-through motions that help our partners engage consumers, students, and businesses worldwide. As a member of our team, you’ll be part of growing a multi-billion-dollar business, charting new areas of innovation, and contributing to our partnership engagements that build, market and launch devices and solutions worldwide. You will also be part of a people-first culture leading with inclusion and values that supports a growth mindset, diversity, and inclusion. If that appeals to you, it’s an exciting time to be here in DPS. #msftgps Responsibilities As a Mixed Reality Technical Specialist, you are expected to advocate for customer/partner objectives while discovering new opportunities for the sales team to pursue. As a Mixed Reality Specialist, you work within a virtual team of technical, partner and consulting resources to help educate your customers at a technical level, demonstrate and prove the value of our solutions, and win the technical decision through credible reference architectures that allow the team to exceed their Objectives & Key Results in context of the success criteria defined by our customers/partners. Being part of this team will allow you to maintain and develop your deep technical expertise across Microsoft and non-Microsoft cloud-based infrastructure technologies and help you expand your career opportunities. Key areas of responsibility: Gathering Insights : Act as a Mixed Reality thought leader in synthesizing and assessing business insights, drawing on information across teams, global best practices, experience across countries and regions, and deep industry expertise. Orchestrate teams across the organization to gather and utilize information on the Mixed Reality customer or partner. Bring in business and industry insights to address the broader business challenges for the customer or partner. Ensure execution of technology strategy and adoption of Mixed Reality and IoT technology at our customers and partners. Trusted Advisor : Act as the voice of the partner and internal advocate by providing insights, feedback, and challenges from the partner to internal teams. Identify and contact partner TDMs/BDMs and begin to advise on Mixed Reality solutions/opportunities and position Mixed Reality offerings. Act as a trusted advisor to internal teams at Microsoft by educating teams on the portfolio of available and upcoming Mixed Reality products, providing business insights, and identify challenges with implementation of Microsoft strategy with the customer or partner, to deepen their understanding of Microsoft's strategy/offer. Building Portfolio/Delivering Key Technologies : Lead Mixed Reality design-in and portfolio planning, identifies key technologies in alignment with sales team needs to integrate into customer or partner portfolio, and work with customer/partner to get feedback on solutions and align with sales team needs. Scale Mixed Reality technologies out to new customers/partners. Manage planning and execution to drive key Mixed Reality technologies to market by leading regular meetings with customers/partners, driving long lead planning and preventing escalated issues. Consider product manufacturing and launch activities and engage as needed to ensure Mixed Reality landing. Value Selling : Adapt and build in Microsoft Mixed Reality technology and solutions for relevancy within the customer/partner portfolio to meet business objectives and competitive advantage; help shape the business case for the customer/partner and deliver the pitch. Drive conversations to align the customer/partner's strengths to identify maximum value opportunities and relevancy for commercial success. Identify potential investment opportunities. Thought Leadership : Participate in internal and external tech community events, become a mentor to junior colleagues to provide technical education, and create content to present at events and contribute to thought leadership. Help the customer/partner to be successful, across multiple groups at an executive level, with their technology implementations and digital transformations by helping to anticipate issues and how to address them. Identify multipliers for technology adoption. Ensure that Mixed Reality solutions meets customer/partner needs while also optimizing the Mixed Reality solutions to drive technology. Qualifications We’re looking for a passionate and competent MR Technical Specialist with a proven track record in 3D technical solutions development and competent customer implementation support in commercial enterprise. All candidates must have deep industry line of business delivery experience. The ideal candidate understands the relevant use cases for commercial augmented reality applications and can help our customers/partners prioritize the highest business value return and make the correct technical recommendations which often combine IoT & AI solutions. The ideal candidate can also help customers/partners implement both Microsoft 1st party & 3rd party Mixed Reality solutions. ​ Qualifications and desired skills: ​ 8+ years of technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 6+ years of technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 4+ years of technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR equivalent experience. Experienced 3D technical competency building and deployment enterprise applications with real world application. Deep technical understanding and appreciation for the variety of MDM, Security, Authentication & advanced infrastructural customer environments you will likely face in role. Strong technical proficiency with Unity, Unreal, OpenGL, Web GL & DirectX. Certification in relevant technologies or disciplines (e.g., Office 365, Power BI, Azure Architect and Development exams, Cloud Platform Technologies, Information Security, Architecture). Comfortable with multiple projects at once, able to prioritize and manage through ambiguity and achieve strong business results. Self-starter, highly motivated, collaborative team player who has a proven track record of developing teams and leaders. Strong passion for hardware and technology, results-focused connector mentality, curious, inclusive, and solution-oriented leader. Technical / Market intelligence and customer insight to determine value proposition and partner opportunity. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Our mission at Microsoft is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our partner ecosystem is at the forefront of bringing this powerful mission to life and it is the Global Partner Solutions (GPS) organization that will drive the transformation of this ecosystem to accelerate cloud adoption for customers, partners and Microsoft. The Independent Software Vendor (ISV) ecosystem is at the center of this evolution and our team that leads this area of the business embodies a culture of diversity, growth, and collaboration, making it a place where teams are challenged, learn, excel, and can do their best work. This role is a unique opportunity to shape the direction of the world’s largest strategic software partner ecosystem across Microsoft’s breadth partner channels in the APAC region. As the Breadth ISV Partner Manager, you will have the opportunity to drive one of the fastest growing businesses at Microsoft that is at the leading edge of the shift to cloud services and digital transformation. This leader represents Microsoft’s ISV strategy to the Partner ecosystem broadly, our ISV s directly, our field teams, and our corporate stakeholders. The ISV Breadth Partner Manager is an influential individual contributor role within the Microsoft Customer and Partner Solutions (MCAPS) organization and across Microsoft. The charter of the Breadth ISV Partner Manager is to partner across Microsoft to develop and advance Microsoft’s breadth partner strategy and drive engagement, solution development, and commercial growth across our breadth ISVs ecosystem globally. The Breadth ISV Partner Manager provides strategic leadership to build the right breadth partner strategy and engagement process to increase breadth capacity and capabilities from within the existing APAC area ecosystem and through the recruitment of new partners aligned with the strategic needs of this partner category. The Breadth ISV Partner Manager is responsible for accelerating our partners’ transformation to the Microsoft Cloud and to evangelize and distinguish Microsoft cloud from other cloud providers. They must be a transformational leader who thinks ahead, leads from the front, and seeks out ways to disrupt markets with new breadth business practices, services and solutions that reimagine the way business is transacted. Responsibilities Breadth Partner Strategy and Execution: Set strategy on how the ISV and MCAPS organizations will provide engagement, expertise, and resources to meet breadth ISV Partner’s technology and commercialization needs and help grow their business and customer reach. Lead and execute the breadth ISV partner engagement, business growth strategy, and overall partner performance (across technical, sales, go-to-market) for all breadth ISV partners across our Solution Areas and Strategic ISVs WW. Provide leadership and breadth ISV voice to the programs, tools and processes required to support ISV growth through high scale, digital engines. Build business cases and secure investments with clear ROI. Lead the breadth ISV Partner performance to Microsoft globally, in addition to the overall ISV Partners satisfaction and success. Engage, influence, and partner with leadership across Marketplace, Global Demand Center, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, and other partner organizations across Microsoft to supplement the breadth ISV vision and strategy. Direct Accountability for Microsoft’s Breadth ISV Partner Performance Partner closely with Marketing, Engineering, Segment, and field teams to deliver against quarterly revenue accountability. Identify opportunities to invest and/or opportunities to implement course correction to exceed revenue targets. Collaborate with Field and Corporate leaders to identify planning focus areas and cases for change. Integrate change management communicated by senior level stakeholders. Remain accountable for success of sales landing directly and by empowering others to own and drive this directly. Execute breadth ISV strategy and plan in APAC, ensuring that ISV Breadth Partner Managers Be the subject matter expert for ISV related breadth co-sell engagement across Microsoft and ISV sales. Work through the strategy, ROI and target modeling efforts for co-sell related programs.  Ensure programs land globally and deliver to intent with regular business review rhythm and best practice sharing. Business Leadership: Make business and investment decisions and drive orchestration (including sales, technical, go-to-market, and channel management) to grow Microsoft business and impact across the ISV partner portfolio. Ensure excellence in execution of go to market and co-sell strategies with partners and sales and scorecard KPI’s are always met and shared accountability between their Partner Development Manager (PDM) teams and other technical, sales, marketing and service teams are clear, agreed and exceeded. Design and lead global performance discussion building a consistent WW rhythm across the GPS ISV Teams and reporting back in to and through corporate stakeholders. Influence leadership across Microsoft to align strategy and resources to help the team achieve targets as measured by revenue, consumption/usage, solution-build, skilling and partner satisfaction. Qualifications Experience in partner strategy, alliance management, enterprise sales, channels, and marketing is required. Effective business management, v-team management, and communication skills are critical. The ability to write and present complex ideas and concepts to a wide range and size of audiences, from CVP to CEO level, is a must. Deep understanding of SMB-to-Enterprise partner business models, industry and competition, digital transformation drivers, cloud platforms, emerging computing trends and their impact on the partner eco-system. 10+ years of related experience in Global, Area level Business Management as a leader of Sales, Customer, Partner teams selling technology solutions/practice development, Cloud/Infrastructure technologies. Proven track record of building deep business relationships with CEO’s, CIO’s, CTO’s, CXOs Strong executive presence including communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort to large and small audiences. Extensive experience of managing virtual teams across functions and geographies Inclusive and collaborative - driving teamwork, diversity, and cross-team alignment Working knowledge of enterprise software management practices, including selection, deployment, and management processes. Strong understanding of cloud computing technologies, business drivers and emerging trends as well as the impact of these on Software and Services partners and their customers. Exceptional decision-making, conflict resolution, problem solving and negotiation skills. BS/BA degree required. MBA or equivalent experience a plus. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Are you looking for an opportunity to build software with some of the largest companies and organizations in the world? Do you want to thrive in and contribute to a culture where different areas of passion and skills empower a happy and high-performing team? Are you excited to learn new technologies? If the answer is yes, then we want you to join our fast-growing team of curious and talented software engineers. Our team, Commercial Software Engineering (CSE), works side by side with engineers from Microsoft’s most strategic customers on cutting-edge technologies. We help them to tackle their toughest technical problems both in the cloud and on the edge. We meet customers where they are, working with the languages, open-source frameworks, and operating systems they use. Our work spans across different industries and covers a broad spectrum of technology domains. We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer who will be based in Singapore. Our team works with customers across the Asia Pacific region, and in some cases further abroad. We work as a team on engagements that typically run from a few weeks to a few months. We use Agile processes and sound software engineering practices to deliver production quality code with our customers. Sharing our work and expertise is also a core part of the value we deliver. We work closely with Microsoft’s product engineering teams, to give feedback to improve our products and contribute to open-source projects and communities. We welcome diversity of all kinds. Our team includes many cultures, educational backgrounds, life stages, identities, and technical skills, and we believe this contributes to our success and that of our customers. If you love learning new technologies, enjoy thinking about challenging engineering problems and, above all, are excited to write quality code with high impact customers, then we’d love to hear from you. Responsibilities Responsibilities Working hands-on with your team and our customers through design and implementation, demonstrating good engineering practices and coding along the way. Exercising your existing skills, learning new things, and then sharing your experiences with those around you, the broader Microsoft organization, and the OSS community. Clearly and effectively communicating your ideas, through words and code. Developing positive relationships with software engineers across Microsoft and with Microsoft product teams. Upholding our delivery standards by following and contributing to our engineering practices & playbook. Qualifications You will have: At least five (5) years of track record working in teams of software engineers in an agile environment, and collaborating with other teams and disciplines to deliver production software that runs at scale. Solid hands-on experience of software engineering fundamentals such as testing, continuous integration, continuous deployment, pull requests and code reviews, source control, work item/issue tracking. Experience of designing and building cloud-native apps and cloud services that run at scale. Experience with Core Cloud Computing Concepts (Compute/Networking/Storage/Identity) on one of the major cloud computing platforms. Experience and desire to learn about and dig deeper on relevant tech platforms and software stacks. Examples include Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Kafka, Cassandra, Go, Kubernetes, .NET Core, Python, Java. You may know of things that should be added to this list, and you can explain why to other software engineers. Experience working in data-driven applications, in areas like relational databases, data warehousing, NoSQL, Big Data. Familiarity with end-to-end implementation of Machine Learning applications and an interest to learn about it. A Bachelor or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline and/or comparable practical professional experience Ability to travel occasionally up to 25% (post-pandemic) #CSE-FY22 #CSE #CSESA Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. In collaboration with other regional SCI leaders linking to the Global SCI agenda with Global Initiatives driving Sensory & Consumer understanding themes. Job_Title: Senior Program Manager - Azure Data Services
Job_Descriptions: Azure Synapse Analytics brings together enterprise data warehousing, observational data and big data analytics technology into a single platform that enables large scale business intelligence and machine learning solutions. With Azure Synapse customers can build their end-to-end analytics solution with a unified experience to ingest, prepare, manage, and serve data for their business intelligence and machine learning needs. We are part of the Azure Data team, building highly scalable distributed systems for data analytics on Azure. We believe in diversity of perspectives, establishing long-term relationships, taking pride in what we do and continuous learning. Azure is growing at a phenomenal pace with Data and AI at the center of how organizations are transforming through the cloud. Azure Data Services group is hiring experienced Senior Program Manager that share our passion to help customers build and modernize their analytics platforms on the cloud. We are looking for a highly motivated individual with strong technical skills in big data, customer orientation, analytical background and exceptional cross-group and cross-geo collaboration skills. In this role, you will drive the ecosystem activity around the Kusto technology and work with large Microsoft customers to realize big data analytics scenarios using Azure Synapse Data Explorer and support their efforts to digitally transform their business and operations. You will work with customers and partners to architect and design the solutions, proof of concepts or pilot projects to make our customers successful. Through these engagements, you will represent the voice of the customer distilling new requirements and issues into improvements for engineering teams. You will also collect patterns and lessons learned from your engagements and turn them into reference architectures, best practices and training for engineering teams and the global Azure Data Services community. Responsibilities Working hands-on with prospects and customers to demonstrate value and driving success from demo to proof-of-concept to design and implementation Capturing best-practices from engagements, field teams and engineering, and sharing with the worldwide Azure Data Services community via whitepapers, blogs, presentations, and training Maintaining deep understanding of complementary and competitive technologies and vendors and be able to design and position a more compelling Azure Data Services based solution Collaborating with Product Management and Development teams to continuously improve Azure Synapse Data Explorer Assisting and advising our partner ecosystem to develop robust, high-quality solutions for customers Organize trainings and workshops to for partner enablement and training Be a trusted advisor to some of our largest customers and guide them in their Azure Synapse Analytics Lifecycle This role might require travel. Qualifications At least 3 years of experience as a Program Manager Experience in building big data and distributed cloud systems Experience with open-source big data technologies and solutions Experience in working closely with data mining experts and big data researchers Experience in working closely with large international companies creating partnerships and strong relationships Knowledge in SQL and KQL (Kusto Query Language) is preferred Passion for technology and quality with a strong customer focus Proven presentation and evangelism capabilities Excellent verbal and written communication skills Sc./BA, MSc. /MA degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline preferred Team player, confident and enthusiastic Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Job Summary: The Manufacturing Engineer performs the lead role in the implementation of manufacturing processes and techniques - and the implementation of LEAN and use of Six Sigma tools. He/she is the owner of their respective manufacturing processes and standards and enforces implementation by training shop floor personnel, implementing and monitoring metrics, and oversight. He/she is responsible to solve complex manufacturing problems and take an active role in troubleshooting quality and production yield related issues within manufacturing. These activities are performed in line with company strategy, and in conformity to relevant standards. Relationships: Direct Supervisor: Manufacturing Team Leader Essential Responsibilities and Duties: Lean Six Sigma Responsible for the implementation of key elements of Lean, such as: standardized work instructions, line balancing, layout and work sequence (routing) optimization, training development matrix, Value Stream Mapping, Kaizen/5S workouts, pull processes, TPM (total preventive maintenance), cell design, and quick changeover/batch-size optimization. Processes Implement process improvements to achieve manufacturing excellence in areas such as process yield (e.g. First Pass Yield, Rolled Throughput Yield), cycle time reduction and productivity. Provide shop floor feedback on product design and manufacturability issues to Engineering and DFMs (e.g. through the use of Engineering Change Requests - ECRs) Review and sign-off on Engineering Change Orders that impact Inventory - including product life cycle issues, obsolescence, etc. Creates, implements, and monitors key performance indicators and metrics on manufacturing process capability and product quality. Monitoring and reducing process costs. Quality Responsible to assist with investigation, root cause analysis and corrective action implementation for manufacturing quality issues. Electrical Competency Experience with electrical/electronic equipment such as Continuity Tester, Power supplies, Soldering systems and Signal Generators. Experience in reviewing interface drawings and electronic circuit schematics. Experience in RF Technology will be an added advantage such as troubleshooting antennas, hands on experience using Network Analyzers & Spectrum Analyzers. Education and Prior Experience: Education: Bachelor’s/Master’s in Electrical engineering Experience: 1-2 years’ experience with strong interest in Manufacturing Key Competencies: Knowledge of LEAN Six Sigma techniques and metrics Knowledge of mechanical and electrical manufacturing processes, including assembly and testing Knowledge of equipment and tools Product knowledge Can function independently and in a team Strong decision making Able to effect change through influence Strong leadership skills Strong mentoring/training skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Knowledge of ergonomics and safety Knowledge of maintenance systems Behavior: Quick learner Strong communication skills in English

Job_Descriptions: Financial Controller – ( based in Surabaya Indonesia) (Our client is a leading independent solutions provider for special filters and laboratory services. With more than 80 years’ experience in the tobacco industry) This position is needs a results-driven and confident qualified accountant as the Financial Controller. He / she will oversee full spectrum of financial control and reporting responsibilities as a country finance head. The Financial Controller will be responsible for managing accounting records, evaluating and managing risk, ensuring compliance with Group policies and regulations, preparing and publishing financial statements, overseeing accounting operations, analyzing financial data and variances, monitoring expenditure, forecasting revenue and profit, coordinating auditing processes, and ensuring accuracy of financial information. Responsibilities Financial Reporting Management Leadership • Financial reporting and oversight of weekly reporting, and month-end and year-end close process • Support annual strategic planning and forecasting processes including setting operational & financial targets • Control quality and ensure timely submission of Actuals, Forecast and Budget exercises • Provide insight on financial performance such as profitability on product margin, expenses and working capital Compliance & Financial Control • Monitor business control effectiveness and develop/execute improvement plans to ensure accurate financial reporting • Implement key controls in accordance with the Group's Minimum Controls Standards in Singapore • Ensure the entities comply with relevant trade compliance regulations • Ability to identify risk and manage these risk with the Division leaders • Coordinating audit processes • Managing credit and foreign exchange risk of the entities • Adhere to all local regulation financial reporting Budgetary • Work with Budget Owners to get an understanding of performance, analyse variances and prepare forecasts/budget. • Lead budget variance commentary and reporting • Target areas of expense overruns/inconsistencies and implement corrective measures Treasury & Secretarial • Compliance with the Group treasury policy • Provide accurate cash-flow forecasting • Monitor and manage working capital and share best practices • Manage banking relationship • Manage company secretarial matters Ethics & Best Practices • Operate within Company policies and procedures such as Essentra PLC Code of Business Ethics and Essentra Accounting Manual with a high level of integrity • Ensure compliance of Company operations to all applicable laws, regulations and standards, regulations and standards, good business practices and company documented procedures (including but not limited to Financial Data Quality Management, ISO 9001, ISO 14001, OHSAS 18001 and OHSAS 14001) • Engage others, promote, and participate in Environmental, Health, and Safety initiatives, focusing on continuous improvement Business Partnering • Act as strong business partner to the Head of Departments (HOD), challenging and debating business ideas and tactics to help develop the business to deliver the group’s business performance objectives. • Support the General Manager in the development and articulation of a short and medium term performance delivery strategy and providing the financial input required to that process The Ideal Candidate • 8 – 10 years of experience in financial controlling and reporting for a regional business with consolidated revenue no less than GBP 50m • Possess some knowledgeable in a global VAT, indirect taxes and statutory filings • Experience of working in well-established global multinationals with matrix reporting structures. Ability to report to a senior level outside the country whilst supporting the local business management • Good communication skills, ability to lead a team of 5-6 Accountants • Experience with proven track record of delivering results in a high growth environment • Strong exposure to financial control; budgeting and management reporting; and ensuring adherence to statutory requirements • Preferable with knowledge of treasury, tax and transfer pricing, but not a must • Exposure to IFRS reporting would be considered advantageous • Eye for details and understand cost drivers in a manufacturing environment. • Experience in product costing, standard cost and operational finance • Degree in Accounting or Finance • Qualified Chartered Accountant from a recognized professional accountancy body/CPA/Post graduate in Accounting, Finance • Excellent skills in MS Excel, Power point and Access To apply Please submit your CV in WORD format with a recent photo. Job Objectives/Job Summary: To manage and optimize operations in the waste management industry. The Operations Executive is responsible for assisting the management with the daily operations. He/She consolidates relevant data and trends to conduct environmental impact assessments and improvise work processes. He also evaluates reported mechanical faults to rectify issues. In performing most of these functions, he recommends and facilitates the implementation and maintenance schedules of equipment and manages incidents related to waste disposal operations. He/She works in a waste management and oversees the handling and disposal operations while ensuring that all activities are completed in a safe and efficient way. He is constantly exposed to unpleasant sights and smells. He also manages team and incidents relating to operations and vehicle/equipment cleanliness and serviceability and communicates with relevant stakeholders and clients. He is organised, responsive, approachable, able to multi-task and capable of interacting with stakeholders. Must be able to embrace new technology with the aim of efficiency. d) Personal Qualities Adaptability, professionalism and, positive attitude and show willingness to learn.

First Page Digital is a digital marketing agency with a passionate team of high-performing online marketing and growth experts. We insist on hiring the finest talent to join our tribe. We are a fast-paced agency that is growing, and we are always looking for the right people and the right fit. We are looking for an experienced Content Manager to join and lead our content team together with our Head of Content of a team of 14 Content Writers and growing. We seek top performers with a relentless focus to detail and who can work independently and in a team, and above all have the hunger and drive to learn within the team and by themselves leading by example. You have got agency experience with driving initiatives, client management and tasks assignment management. Leading the team by example and walking the talk, you must be a master at copy writing yourself. You are amazed and fascinated with content marketing, always trying to improve your knowledge and experience. You dive deep into industry blogs and you know that nothing beats taking action from what you learn. You will be working within our internal content team and managing the day to day deliverables, content brief task assignment to provide killer copy for content and SEO campaigns. You will be involved in executing content strategies, concepts and deliveries. You will be working with our clients to improve their campaigns by driving engagement and reach through killer copies recognised by search engines for SEO keywords. All this work will focus on driving the maximum number of conversions, sales, leads and bookings. We are after a switched-on Copywriting professional and a Content Team Lead who can work together with our Head of Content to manage and build a strong content team and have the following background: · Agency background understanding the ins and outs of content deliverables and tasks assignments · Experience in driving new initiatives to improve on internal processes · Experience in team management and have led a team in the past before · Task distribution based on current team's workload · Client management experience in joining sales pitches and meetings with existing clients · Knowing how to set performance measurements for the team and individuals · Being approachable and empathetic towards the team (being a mentor to the team) · Proofing content and providing constructive feedback to the team · Walking the talk by being able to write killer copy in English · Analyse to identify areas of opportunities in content gaps to drive as much ROI as possible · Write effective direct response ad copy that sells including other types of content · Deliver copy for advertising, social, email, websites and SEO campaigns About you: · Preferably with an agency background of 2+ years of managing a content team, overall content strategy · Process driven with a high attention to detail · Experience with SEO & the role content plays in this channel We aren't your average agency. Everything we do is aimed at helping our clients maximise the amount of leads, sales and bookings they generate online. We have our finger on the pulse, constantly innovating in the fields of SEO, paid traffic, social, content and conversions. We are a young company with a flexible mindset and a "get it done" attitude. This is a great opportunity to learn from energetic and highly skilled online marketing and growth team while building a solid career in the most exciting industry globally. Rewards you deserve: · Generous remuneration with company medical and dental insurance coverage · Fitness and Wellness benefits with Class Pass membership · Welfare leaves such as birthday leave, study leave, marriage leaves are all applicable · Collaborate with a strong, dynamic team. · Working side by side talented individuals. · Always new and exciting projects. · Fun, dynamic company that’s on the move! Why us: We want Singapore’s top talent and recognise that means paying them accordingly. Our newly transformed office is a great space to inspire creativity, as well as being close to cafes and public transport. You'll be amongst a highly engaged team of the country's most talented digital marketers and growth experts, with solid prospects for upward mobility. Please attach your CV and we'll be in touch for a confidential chat. Let's do great things together!

Interested in building mission critical analytical solutions in the cloud? Want to work with products that push the boundaries of messaging and event-driven computing? We are looking to hire an experienced Senior Program Manager that shares our passion to help customers build and modernize their analytics platforms on the cloud. To excel in this role, you should possess deep solutions architecture and technical expertise, strong business acumen, and clearly communicate at all levels with the customer. The services you deliver will empower IT professionals across the globe to deliver messaging infrastructure that forms the backbone of enterprise architectures and modern serverless application platforms. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment, solving tough technical problems and have a passion for data analytics, we want to hear from you. Responsibilities This Program Manager role will work across the Azure Messaging product family. You will work with customers and partners to architect and design the solutions, proof of concepts or pilot projects to make our customers successful. Through these engagements, you will represent the voice of the customer distilling new requirements and issues into improvements for engineering teams. You will also collect patterns and lessons learned from your engagements and turn them into reference architectures, best practices and training for engineering teams and the global Azure Data Services community. You will work with our partners and enable them to help our customers maximize value from Azure data platform. Responsibilities also include: Working hands-on with prospects and customers to demonstrate value and driving success from demo to proof-of-concept to design and implementation Capturing best-practices from engagements, field teams and engineering, and sharing with the worldwide Azure Data Services community via whitepapers, blogs, presentations, and training Maintaining deep understanding of complementary and competitive technologies and vendors and be able to design and position a more compelling Azure Data Services based solution Collaborating with Product Management and Development teams to continuously improve the product Assisting and advising our partner ecosystem to develop robust, high-quality solutions for customers Organize trainings and workshops to for partner enablement and training Be a trusted advisor to some of our largest customers in implementing Azure Data Services Design end-to-end solution experiences This role might require travel. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field, OR equivalent industry experience At least 3+ years business strategy, product management or consulting roles with direct customer engagement experience At least 2+ years of experience with any messaging technologies including AMQP and JMS and enterprise message brokers such as Azure Service Bus, IBM MQ, Apache ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ, Apache Kafka, AWS Kinesis Preferred Qualifications: Experience with enterprise integrations using queues and topics (pub/sub) Passion for delivering mission-critical infrastructure in a fast-paced environment Strong collaboration experience as well as ability to find win/win solutions Proven ability to drive strong business results Experience delivering cloud-based products and services Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work. #CSEFY22

C#.Net: i.e. (.Net Frameworks, WPF, WCF, MVC, MVVM, XAML, Xamarin) Python: i.e. (TensorFlow, Keras, Theano, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, NumPy, Pandas) JavaScript: i.e. (ES6, Node.js, NPM, Sails.js, Ember.js, React, Mocha, Electron) JavaScript framework experience (e.g. Ember, React, Angular) jQuery, CSS, and HTML Excellent working knowledge and understanding of version control systems such as SVN, TFS & GIT. Organization: IFC - International Finance Corporation Country: Singapore City: Singapore Office: IFC in Singapore Follow @UNjobs E T Consultant Job #: req15156 Organization: IFC Sector: Treasury Grade: EC1 Term Duration: 1 year 0 months Recruitment Type: Local Recruitment Location: Singapore,Singapore Required Language(s): English Preferred Language(s): Closing Date: 2/26/2022 (MM/DD/YYYY) at 11:59pm UTC Description IFC�a member of the World Bank Group�is the largest global development institution focused on the private sector in emerging markets. We work in more than 100 countries, using our capital, expertise, and influence to create markets and opportunities in developing countries. In fiscal year 2021, IFC committed a record $31.5 billion to private companies and financial institutions in developing countries, leveraging the power of the private sector to end extreme poverty and boost shared prosperity as economies grapple with the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. For more information, visit www.ifc.org The Syndicated Loans and Management Department ("CSL") is responsible for raising external funds for IFC clients through the B Loan program, Parallel Loans, Credit Insurance Policies ("CIP"), and the Managed Co-Lending Portfolio Program ("MCPP"). Our syndications partners are international and local commercial banks, Development Finance Institutions ("DFI"), funds and institutional investors. The Department is also responsible for the ongoing syndicated loan portfolio management engagements with third-party investors. Market Intelligence : Conduct industry and bank market research and pricing data analysis, including secondary market pricing. Follow international lending and credit insurance markets as well as banking activities to understand and anticipate global and/or regional trends. Prepare regular syndicated market updates and pricing reports for the various regional markets. Syndications: Review company, economic and financial information for new transactions. Prepare information memoranda, executive summaries and other reports for the bank market in conjunction with the relevant Investment Department. On assigned projects, support Officers in conducting deal specific market soundings and developing lists of prospective banks for individual syndications Distribute marketing information to prospective B Loan participants, Parallel Lenders and Insurers through web-based platforms On assigned projects, support Officers in the syndication of IFC B Loans to financial institutions, Parallel loans to DFls and local banks, MCPP loans to MCPP investors, insurers in the use of Unfunded Risk Participations & Credit Insurance Policies, and sell participation in IFC A Loans in the secondary market. On MCPP projects, prepare MCPP teasers, MCPP Commitment Summaries and periodic MCPP portfolio updates Syndicated Portfolio Management: Prepare and coordinate with Investor Operations Group (IOG) the distribution of portfolio documents to existing B loan participants, parallel lenders, insurers and MCPP investors. On a selective basis, independently manage assigned portfolio deals by (i) Providing high-quality service to B Loan participants/parallel lenders/insurers/MCPP investors on ongoing project work (information transmission on key developments, responding to inquiries, restructurings); (ii) Coordinating syndicated partners processing and approval of waivers and amendments; and, (iii) Ensuring that managed deal-specific contractual responsibilities with B Loan participants/parallel lenders/insurers/MCPP investors are being met. Prepare Semi-Annual Portfolio Reviews Business Promotion & Relationship Management. c7VNfZv 7FHT3 Prepare power point presentations and other information for internal and external marketing. Support Officers in developing and maintaining relationships with international and regional commercial banks, other prospective B Loan Participants, DFIs, insurance companies and institutional investors. Selection Criteria B.A. in finance or business with a strong component of finance and accounting course work, with the expectation of pursuing a Master's degree after several years. At least two year of working experience, preferably with a leading international bank or similar financial institution in emerging markets. Understanding of international commercial bank market and multiple debt instruments. Preferably experience with loan documentation and credit issues. Experience in using available research tools including Dealogic - Loan Analytics, Bloomberg and market publications and bookrunning platforms such as DebtDomain, lntralinks or Syndtrak. Proactive, resourceful, flexible and self-motivated. Strong team player with demonstrated capacity for hard work. Able to manage multiple tasks concurrently, prioritize effectively and adhere to deadlines while always paying attention to details. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. A good command of one or more regional languages would be a major advantage. Clear, accurate articulation of issues, problems and solutions. Use of tact, diplomacy and good interpersonal skills in internal and external communications. World Bank Group Core Competencies We are proud to be an equal opportunity and inclusive employer with a dedicated and committed workforce, and do not discriminate based on gender, gender identity, religion, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or disability. Learn more about working at the World Bank and IFC, including our values and inspiring stories. Note: The selected candidate will be offered a one-year appointment, renewable for an additional one year, at the discretion of the World Bank Group, and subject to a lifetime maximum ET Appointment of two years. If an ET appointment ends before a full year, it is considered as a full year toward the lifetime maximum. Former and current ET staff who have completed all or any portion of their second-year ET appointment are not eligible for future ET appointments.

Overview Are you ready to help position and market innovative and industry-leading software solutions in the education and training space? In this role, you will participate in the development and execution of innovative product marketing campaigns and programs for AvePoint EduTech. What will you be doing? As a Marketing Intern, you are responsible for conceptualizing and building up awareness and engagement in AvePoint EduTech and its solutions through various marketing campaigns and activities that feed quality lead to our sales channel. You will work with the Product Marketing team in the Singapore EduTech HQ to develop targeted campaigns and programs to position and market our core products and platforms and to refine targeting and messaging based on target audiences, channel engagement, and performance metrics. Your responsibilities include : Create and execute awareness and demand generation to support field marketing in the education and training sector. Market intelligence & customer segmentation – being the expert on your buyers, how they buy, and their buying criteria; being the expert on your competition and how to win - creating messages that spark conversations, and eliciting compelling needs that our solutions can address. Research and summarise the trends in the EduTech industry and use the insights to develop and deliver cohesive marketing campaign strategies, including creating messaging that fits the audience mindset/needs within that experience (e.g. website, in-product messaging, on-boarding, blog, emails, events) and maximizes the strengths of each channel or experience. Working with the in-house design team on developing new solutions brochures and corporate/product videos. Organizing marketing collaterals for tradeshows and engaging clients to generate brand awareness and build the leads funnel. Developing a range of customer testimonials for external/internal use, including written case studies. OK, I’m interested… is this the job for me? We look for people who value agility, passion, and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn, grow, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best for our customers, partners, team, and you. In this role, you are tasked with creating and participating in successful demand creation campaigns so you will need to have the ability to think creatively and strategically and easily able to switch between thinking and doing. Other qualities you’ll need to be a fit for this role include: Currently enrolled in marketing, business, or a relevant field of study in year 3 or above in a polytechnic or university in Singapore. Keen interest in marketing, branding, design, and business development in technology solutions. Passionate about the Education sector, lifelong learning, HR learning & development. Job Details KANTAR PUBLIC Consultant – Data Analytics & Evaluation Sectors: Government, NGO, Government Linked Companies; Academic Research Institutions Location: Based in Singapore Coverage: Singapore About Kantar Public We are a leading evidence and advisory business for governments, multilateral organisations, and the private sector. With our roots in the world’s oldest and best-known social research businesses, we have been partnering with clients across the globe to answer the next generation of public policy challenges for almost ninety years. From advising governments on gender equality in the workplace, to providing the measure of national inflation, transforming the citizen experience of public services, or improving access to education in lower income countries – our consultants work across the breadth of public policy to build the quality of the public realm. Visit www.kantarpublic.com for more information. Kantar Public is looking for an exceptional candidate to join and grow our Policy Development, Evaluation & Data Analytics domain. Responsibilities: Client Management & Consultancy Client servicing : Develop in-depth knowledge and understanding of your clients and their business in all interactions, and deliverables and analysis conducted for them. Contribute to client discussions at briefings, regular project meetings and analysis stage to better understand their business issues End-to-end project management : Responsible for establishing strong client relationships through excellent project management and client servicing Grow a team of high-performing analysts : Manage the growth of juniors through regular career conversations Cost Management & Financial acumen: Contributes to business development opportunities including writing tenders, costing and participating in pitches. Analytics Analytics sense-making: Understand the differing policy needs of public sector clients and write/support proposals by identifying the right analytics solution that serves their needs Data analysis and modelling : Run custom models to solve specific research questions, interpret and validate model results. Analyse individual-level data and perform statistical techniques to evaluate the effectiveness of public programmes and campaigns Craft data-driven narratives and reports: Discover and understand policy challenges and deliver compelling data stories to help public sector clients achieve policy outcomes. Support the team to ensure efficient delivery of analytics projects connecting various data sources to deliver important insights and stories. Evaluate impact of complex programmes: Work on applying theory-based approaches to evaluation design through the usage of clear programme logic models / theories of change, and translating these to outcome frameworks and measurement approaches Key Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree / Master’s Degree, preferably in Statistics, Business Analytics or Applied Economics Solid understanding and grounding of statistics and its applications to analytical solutions Strong knowledge of quantitative research method capabilities to lead the design of quantitative methods needed for analysis in projects (e.g. data wrangling, identifying outliers, regression diagnostics, evaluation studies, creating indices) Hands-on experience of statistical modelling and techniques such as clustering, regression modelling techniques, max-diff, Bayesian statistics and modelling A keen interest to work across different domains in analytics such as econometrics and predictive analytics Proficient in the use of SPSS and R in data analysis, or other similar software for data analysis (e.g. Python, Stata) Preferably at least 4 years of research and/or consulting experience (within government, public/third sector/academic or at a research consulting firm) Genuine interest in issues facing the public sector and desire to make a positive social impact A natural problem-solver who is self-motivated and has a passion for learning A collaborative team player who is also unafraid to articulate his or her points-of-view Organised, meticulous, deadline driven and able to multi-task Works well under pressure, with the patience and perseverance to see through long timelines Strong verbal, written and presentation skills Currently resides in Singapore Location Singapore, Scotts RoadSingapore Kantar Rewards Statement At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us. We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes. Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Company Description H&M is on a journey to becoming the leading destination for style, creativity and culture. We want to enable, empower and engage teams while building on our passion for being the truly customer-centric company we are. On this journey we want to encourage our teams to learn and grow meaningfully, unleashing their full potential – fulfilling our Employee Value Proposition (EVP), we are a place of possibilities and where you can Be Yourself & More. Job Description You are responsible for supporting the brand and hiring managers in strengthening People and Culture, by setting and implementing talent acquisition strategies and initiatives to deliver high performing teams, drive continuous talent growth as well as acquiring right skills and competency – future proofing the business from a talent perspective. You contribute actively to employer branding, both internal and external, bringing to live our Employee Value Proposition and building a true sense of belonging among teams. Key responsibilities:Attract, Recruit and Introduce Initiate, propose and take actions to make H&M an attractive employer, both internally and externally. Analyze future teams’ needs, in terms of skills and competency, establish an action plan  to close gaps through meaningful collaboration with Country HRM as well as respective hiring managers and stakeholders. Implement and uphold a quality recruitment process for all positions, inline with global and local routines as well as labor legislation. Supports the development of people centricity in hiring managers by introducing the talent mindset - influencing managers through recruitment process and frequent conversation about talents. Network and maintain strong connections to talents, talents pools and talent agencies, through frequent chats and is up to date with insights on industry trends. Collaborate, Manage and Develop You are the speaking partner to hiring managers and supports with acquiring right talent for the team as well as mapping future skills and competency needs. The recruitment journey is fully managed and coordinated by you from start to finish ensuring a good candidate experience, positive employer branding as well as ensuring deadlines are met and feedbacks given as appropriate. You support the development of hiring managers in taking a wholistic view of their teams through influencing and catalytic actions – such as regular check ins on performance and development potentials, upskilling needs, disengagement and flight risk, general well being and psychological safety. Provide HR support and consultation to managers through coaching, training and advice that are aligned to H&M Brand’s culture and value as well as EVP. Qualifications Being part of this journey means there is not one clear path. We ask of you to be open to change and take part in creating an organization for the future. This is an opportunity for open minded team players that by being curious, innovative and forward-thinking want to change our business and the whole industry. We ask you to be yourself, drive results, work towards goals and go for it with everything you’ve got. Besides your personality we see that you have / are: Formal education and adequate work experience in HR / Talent / People growth related field. Experience in talent acquisition within retail setting in Sales, Support, and Store roles, as well as acquisition during change and transformation. Capable in identifying talent opportunities with hiring managers as well as developing on future needs and talent pipeline of  teams. Ability to interact confidently, clearly and respectfully with stakeholders, influence and handle pushback in high pressure situation. Proficient in Microsoft suites of application and is confident building business cases and presentation to large audience and stakeholders. Excellent internal drive, results driven and willingness to learn and feed the organization with new insights. Effective and inspiring communicator, charismatic, clear and convincing – positively energetic and is not afraid to build relations on both a personal and group level. Influential and catalyst leader with experience in leading teams, self, as well as meaningful collaboration with key stakeholder. Experience working in an executional, cross functional role - collaborating with multiple teams across different geographies. Additional Information ARE YOU READY TO JOIN US? If you feel that your passion, personal values, ambition and experience are a match –  please apply (including Cover Letter, Resume, and if applicable: 360 Leadership Feedback report, Strengths Finder, Myers Briggs) no later than 18th FEB 2022. We’re more about personality and competence than qualifications, so don’t worry if your skills aren’t a perfect match. This position is based in Singapore Office and will report to Talent Manager - SGMYVN.

At Amplitude, we’re building analytics that helps our customers use data to build better products and drive growth. We’re already the analytics platform of choice for many top product teams around the world including Microsoft, Square, and Hubspot. Our team is defining the future of how companies interact with data to build better products. We are looking for Account Executives who know software sales and how to identify and win opportunities with some of the fastest-growing and most influential digital product companies. We want the best of the best and we make sure that top performers are rewarded. Sound like you? Keep reading... As an Enterprise Account Executive , you will: Build and grow a new market focusing on enterprise accounts through prospecting, collaborating with an SDR and networking Become an expert on Amplitude's product and conduct discovery calls, customized demos, and presentations to prospective customers. Effectively sell the value of Amplitude to key stakeholders within the account while navigating a complex sales cycle including multiple stakeholders across product, engineering, analytics, and marketing Collaborate well with team members and forecast accurately Exceed quarterly and annual targets. You'll be a great addition to the team if: You have 3-5+ years of closing Enterprise SaaS Experience in the Big Data, Analytics, Mobile or MarTech space You’re able to tell a story using data You have experience building, leading and growing new business within enterprise companies You have experience with account and territory planning You’ve maintained a successful track record of being a top performer You have the passion to work and thrive in a team setting Who We Are The Company: Amplitude is filled with humble, life-long learners who are eager to help one another and the company succeed. Our values of growth mindset, ownership, and humility are core to the way we work: we’re tenacious in the face of challenges, we take the initiative to solve problems that drive our shared success, and we operate from a place of empathy and openness, seeking to understand many points of view. We care about the well-being of our team: along with a stipend to fully cover excellent health insurance, we offer flexible time off, a monthly wellness stipend, delicious team lunch & snacks, commuting benefits, a 12-week parental leave, a generous Learning & Development stipend, and a full 10 year window to exercise your stock options. The Product: Amplitude is the world's #1 product intelligence platform– we empower teams to use customer data to build great product experiences for growth.  We’re super proud of what we’ve built and continue to build on: a platform that enables companies to thrive. Other fun facts about Amplitude: Founded in 2012, Amplitude is backed by Sequoia Capital, IVP, Battery Ventures, Benchmark Capital, Y Combinator and other top tier investors. Twenty of the Fortune 100 are now customers of Amplitude as are innovative brands such as Atlassian, Twitter, Peloton, FuboTV, and Thredup. We have offices in San Francisco (HQ), New York, Austin, Singapore, Amsterdam, London, and Paris. Our mascot is the datamonster, who loves to chow down on all your numbers, charts, and graphs. Nom nom. Amplitude provides equal employment opportunities (EEO). All applicants are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation. Amplitude’s D&I Commitment: Amplitude believes that diversity enables creation of better products, ability to solve complex problems, and drive more powerful solutions. In order to make diversity possible, we commit to striving to create an environment of inclusion: an environment focused on psychological safety, empathy, and human connection, which will allow employees of all backgrounds to feel the care they need to thrive.

Accountabilites Management of and participation in any ad-hoc projects, as necessary Key Stakeholders Resourcing Team: Resourcing Specialists / Resourcing Support Officers Line Managers Learning ITO team Property team New Joiners Our Ideal Candidate 4 + years of experience preferrably with TA or admin executive background. Recognized Diploma or Degree, ideally HR related IHRP CA qualifications will be a plus Mature disposition, strong communication and relationship management skills Ability to prioritise, multi-task and handle different competing initiatives concurrently Confident individual who is able to communicate and engage with people of varying background and seniority levels Ability to adapt and work across cultures, environment and time zones particular on a remote/virtual basis Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and complete tasks efficiently with minimum supervision Keen eye for detail to ensure service level agreements and standards are adhered to Conservative risk-taker who can remain objective and manage governance of policies Proficient in MS Office applications Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.
