What the role is Emergency Preparedness (EP) oversees strategies, policies, as well as operational matters pertaining to peacetime and crisis management for the MND Family. It formulates and coordinates emergency plans, operations, trainings and resources that are vital to ensure business continuity for MND and our Statutory Boards (SBs). In addition, it coordinates EP initiatives, National Emergency (NE) and contingency planning with other Ministries/Government Agencies. It also drives and supports emergency and ground exercises for MND HQ and our SBs e.g. provision of emergency quarantine housing facilities during a disease outbreak, etc. As part of its planning role, it also undertakes research in EP or other MND-related issues involving public infrastructure and housing. What you will be working on You will assist to develop, review and implement policies and standards to help build the Ministry's capacity and capability in contingency planning and emergency preparedness. This will require you to liaise and work with our Statutory Boards and various Government Agencies or relevant companies to develop contingency and emergency operations plans, organising and conduct training, exercises and operational readiness related initiatives and programmes. You will also help to conduct NE training/workshops for the Ministry's essential personnel; formulate exercise scenarios/validation checklist and participate in exercises conducted by Ministry of Home Affairs and/or Homefront agencies. What we are looking for A Degree in any discipline; 3 years of working experience in contingency planning, operational risk management, incident/crisis management and in running of exercises; Ability to conceptualise nd develop operation plans; Good interpersonal, verbal, written and facilitation skills, Be able to work independently across teams, agencies and stakeholders in a professional manner; Ability to handle rapid developments in a crisis situation is critical. Applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing of this job posting.

Job_Title: Senior Compliance Manager/Compliance Manager, Sustainability Reporting (Financia
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Be part of the ACRA’s Sustainability Reporting Financial Team. You will be shaping the Sustainability Reporting (SR) landscape and regulatory regime for Singapore-incorporated companies. The Team works closely with various government agencies and private sector in this Sustainability Reporting journey. At the international level, the team participates at international forums, seminars, etc. as a Singapore representative or for learning opportunities. Through frequent close contact with industry practitioners, international regulators and other stakeholders, you will be shaping the corporate environment and regulations in the Sustainability Reporting space, fostering a more inclusive and sustainable future for generations to come. What you will be working on As a key member of ACRA’s Sustainability Reporting Team, your key responsibilities include: Co-developing the implementation roadmap of Sustainability Reporting for all companies across the economy in Singapore; Monitoring international developments and emerging issues in Sustainability Reporting standards, assurance and other regulatory requirements; Providing strategic and technical support in the development of Sustainability Reporting standards, assurance and other regulatory requirements for local adoption in Singapore, balancing market participants’ need for globally consistent, comparable, and reliable Sustainability Reporting by companies and compliance burden; Co-developing innovative green fintech solutions to facilitate Sustainability Reporting preparation, filing and consumption of Sustainability Reporting information in Singapore, making Singapore a vibrant and trusted green financial hub; Building internal and industry expertise on Sustainability Reporting; and Developing and implementing compliance and enforcement strategy for regulating Sustainability Reporting. What we are looking for Professional qualifications in Accountancy or related fields Minimum 6 years of working experience in accounting or related fields. Relevant experience in sustainability/environment/CSR/business management is preferred. Keen interest and passion for shaping policies and environment relating to Sustainability Reporting. Ability to develop technical expertise and provide insightful analysis on Sustainability Reporting standards, assurance, and other regulatory requirements. An appreciation for robust collection of data, with the tenacity to make Sustainability Reporting preparation, filing and consumption process seamless, accurate and meet stakeholders’ needs. Excellent collaboration and stakeholder engagement skills, with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Ability to work well independently and collaboratively in a team. Ability to innovate and be creative in problem-solving.

Please limit your file types to . doc, . docx, . pdf, . txt, . jpeg, .xls and . xlsx. Only applications received through this email will be considered. Please note that applications will only be processed if the compulsory sections in the form are completed, and email and documents are labelled correctly. You will need to submit your application by 27 February 2022, 11.00 PM. What the role is As a Student Welfare Officer (SWO), you will provide social support to students-at-risk. You will also work with their families and other community partners to address barriers to learning and strengthen the safety net for these students. What you will be working on RESPONSIBILITIES Provide student-centric case work support for students-at-risk and their families Act as a mentor for students-at-risk and empower them to make informed life choices Visit homes to assess the needs of students-at-risk and their families Refer students’ families to the relevant agencies to enhance their access to community resources and services Collaborate with community agencies to mitigate issues for the students-at-risk and their families Work with the school’s student support team on early identification, case management and proactive measures to avert the onset of at-risk behaviours among students Monitor and manage statutory cases Help to re-integrate students who have been absent from school What we are looking for REQUIREMENTS Passion and disposition for working with students-at-risk and their families, and a positive belief in their potential Cultural sensitivity, collaborative and an openness to diverse views Emotional stability, resourcefulness and resilience Ability to manage complex and serious school absenteeism / statutory cases, as well as provide consultation to school leaders on such cases Applicants should have the fitness and resilience required to engage students safely and carry out their duties effectively. Preferably with at least 5 years of working experience. Casework experience in the social service sector, working with and supporting students-at-risk and families would be an advantage. To ensure a COVID-safe environment for activities in our schools, we will only consider fully vaccinated applicants unless you are certified to be medically ineligible for vaccines under the National Vaccination Programme. As part of the shortlisting process, you are required to complete a declaration on your vaccination status and provide proof of vaccination. A doctor’s memo is required if you are medically ineligible for vaccination. In general, applicants can expect to hear from us within 4 weeks of the close of the application window. In the event where we receive a high number of applications, applicants will receive an update on their status within 6 weeks of the close of the window. Job_Title: Domestic Appliances - Regional Accounting Manager (Statutory& Fiscal Accounting)
Job_Descriptions: Job Title Domestic Appliances - Regional Accounting Manager (Statutory& Fiscal Accounting) Job Description Key areas of responsibilities: Statutory Accounting and reporting Operations Primary contact point for external auditors Contact point for Third party service providers on Statutory Compliance and local authorities Review the translation of IFRS/GAAP accounts to Local GAAP via statutory adjustments Ensure data for statutory reporting, fiscal reporting and any other related information are provided with accuracy & on time Manages Statutory and Periodic Internal Audits and provide support to Business Partner during audits. Any audit adjustments/findings are reconciled and resolved together with Business Partner. Support requests from local regulatory authorities Ensure compliance of all Statutory reporting requirements are completed on time. Accounting operations (RtR) Takes co-responsibility with the Finance Business Partner (BP) over the integrity of financial and management reporting, and work to proactively advise the BP on the impact of accounting standards on different business scenarios. Responsible for the Month end closing (MEC) process, including review of the Trial Balance and analytical reviews. Work closely with a third-party outsourced party, including review and approval of journal posting prepared by them and ensure MEC related issues are resolved timely and reporting timelines are met. Reviews the Balance Sheet Account Reconciliation and performs Internal Control evaluation and assessment and ensures reporting timelines are met. Interacts closely with the business to proactively advise on accounting requirements and potential risks to the financial processes in order to drive better business decisions. Leads and coordinates resolution of accounting and recording related issues with various stakeholders to drive resolution of issues and to build stronger processes. Work closely with Purchase-to-Pay (PTP) team to ensure timely recording with accuracy of our commitments and payment to vendors Determines accounting treatment for events and transactions of a complex, unique, and/or judgmental accounting nature, as well as to apply new/revised accounting policies in consultation with Technical Accounting and Oversight (TA&O). Builds knowledge over business requirements, financial accounting processes and the underlying Market/BG processes within the Finance and non-Finance community, and keep the organization updated on business developments relevant to accounting processes and accounting integrity. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience: Bachelor's Degree with at least 5 years of related accounting/audit work experience. Strong analytic tool skills (Excel mandatory and SAP/BW is preferred). Able to work well within a team and independently. Possesses good problem-solving and analytical skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Why should you join Domestic Appliances? Philips’ Domestic Appliances purpose is simple yet powerful: helping people to turn their houses into homes. Through meaningful innovation, we improve the lives of people, helping them to lead healthier and happier lives every day. We have incredible products, solutions and strong market foundations. As a leading player in domestic appliances, we offer sustainable products across kitchen appliances, coffee, air, garment and home care. The successful product ranges include the renowned Airfryer, Espresso Machine with LatteGo, the Perfect Care Elite steam generator, Air Purifier and SpeedPro Max vacuum cleaner. We are also known as Walita, Preethi, Saeco and Gaggia. In Philips Domestic Appliances we work with contagious positivism. We believe that inclusion comes before diversity and all voices are heard. When you join our closely-connected and diverse team, you'll be joining a global family. Like all families, we grow together and support each other. In our drive for digital transformation success, we partner to grow and deliver. We celebrate our wins together. Our company is headquartered in The Netherlands, and has innovation, manufacturing, and commercial centers across the globe, with presence in over 100 countries. We employ approximately 7,000 talented individuals who bring innovation to customers and consumers. Our goal is for you to grow every day, and to support you to become the very best version of yourself. We are committed to providing the highest levels of consumer satisfaction, underpinned by our quality approach. We make conscious choices caring for people’s homes and our planet. We grow responsibly and sustainably.

Job_Title: Head of CRM and Loyalty, SEA
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Diageo is the world’s leading premium drinks company with an outstanding collection of brands, such as Johnnie Walker, Smirnoff, Baileys, Captain Morgan, Tanqueray and Guinness. Our purpose – Celebrating life, every day, everywhere – has an important role in our company, for our people, our diversity, our brands, in how we perform and how we create shared value. Our ambition is to create the best performing, most trusted and respected Consumer Products Company in the world. To achieve these, we need the world’s very best people. Feel inspired? Then this may be the opportunity for you. About You We’re looking for an individual to represent SEA voice in Luxury loyalty program strategic thinking, design, deployment and roll out in markets. About the Role This role will be main point of contact CRM projects and luxury loyalty program activations.  Own the implementation of the program locally. Client strategy and project management Define KPI for activation and retention success, refine dashboards and monitor Lifecycle KPIs to gather insights on consumer behaviour and drive actionable next steps including a try and learn roadmap. Accompany markets into implementing their local CRM strategy and client centric campaigns, based on Regional and global guidelines Lead a South East Asia CRM community involving key stakeholders within markets to share the best practices regarding client experience and treatment Define the activation rules, consumers segmentation, program benefits and rewards in partnership with the Global Team and the other regional stakeholders Ensure the excellent execution of campaigns and consumers activities by working closely with regional and local marketing teams CRM data, analysis & recommendation Actively share regional CRM data and analysis with the implementation and regular sharing of a CRM dashboard, monitoring and measuring luxury consumers KPIs (recruitment, retention/loyalty, reactivation, by brands, by market…) Measure campaigns success and efficiency to achieve CRM program objectives & share recommendations to the Global Team based on South East Asia learnings & needs Brief and seek support of vendors and agencies on specific studies to gain knowledge on our consumers and improve our targeting / campaign efficiency (i.e. predictive purchase analysis…) Master CRM data analysis system and be able to mentor local CRM teams into maximizing usage of the tool to perform analysis Orchestration Partner with agencies and the global team to better understand members, craft beautiful email and in-app experiences, and align messaging. Maintain holistic view of each luxury campaigns, and ensure all the functions in the region and markets are working in sync to achieve campaign objectives Analyze overall campaign success and provide qualitative feedback to marketing team and global team to nourish the discussion regarding Y+1 campaign Participate actively with other teams within the organization to create luxury experiences, benefits or rewards that will enrich our luxury loyal program Experience required/Skills/Capabilities/Languages Luxury industry experience is a must. Experience in designing and managing CRM programs end to end for luxury clients highly desired. Structured analytic thinking, you take the time to estimate the impact of initiatives by setting assumptions and validating via data when possible. Strong project management skills, organization and ability to evolve in a matrix environment with various functions across the organization Results-driven and metrics-obsessed, you love a good challenge and apply both creativity and analytical rigor in solving problems. You have a proven track record of moving metrics. Diversity statement Celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture is core to Diageo’s purpose of “celebrating life every day everywhere”. This purpose is, in itself, inclusive in nature, as it values everybody irrespective of background, disability, religion, gender identity, sexuality or ethnicity. We know that for our business to thrive and for Diageo to realize its ambition, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills and capabilities in each of the 180 countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base. We view diversity as one of the key enablers that helps our business to grow and our values, purpose and standards set the conditions for us to respect the unique contribution each person brings. Flexibility is key to success in our business and many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, compressed hours, flexible location. Please talk to us about what flexibility means to you and don’t let anything stop you from applying. Job Description Summary The Aviation Field Service Engineer will act as the point of contact for all customer related technical issues, supporting Programs, the AOC 24/7 team providing technical advice & assistance to the customer in the operation, maintenance, repair, logistic support, & installation of jet engines. You will provide on-site interpretation of OEM data & technical instructions, and communication to internal organizations regarding status of engine programs, events, & trends. The FSE function is to prevent the next event by supporting operational issues as they arise and managing the Technical Program plan for each engine model they support, including updating customer progress on CI’s, AD’s and SB incorporation. In this role you will need to build a trusting, influential relationship with your customer at all levels of management. Job Description Essential Responsibilities: Serve as the primary GE on-site or mobile Technical representative before, during, and after the Aircraft enters service Provide program leadership, technical direction, and assistance to the customer in the operation, inspection, maintenance, and repair of assigned jet engine product lines Perform duties as the FSE for all assigned GE product lines and assist the customer with technical understanding of the operation, maintenance, and trouble-shooting of multiple types of GE products Review effectiveness of maintenance actions to identify training needs Apply Six Sigma / LEAN analytical tools to assist the customer with proactive reliability and management or procedural improvements Assist customer with improving reliability and reducing cost of ownership Provide single point of contact to the customer, customer team, and all other GE stakeholders Assist the factory with data collection and timely reporting to facilitate fleet performance analysis, including marketing intelligence and sales opportunities for services, and support Assist customer with spare parts ordering, issues resolution, and RSPL provisioning Provide recommendations on proactive maintenance based on engine data trend shifts. Qualifications/Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university (or High School Diploma / GED with preference in Aerospace) Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in Aerospace engineering or Airline operational support Ability and willingness to travel for months at a time to various locations, as required Desired Characteristics: Bachelor’s Degree in Aerospace Engineering or similar Strong oral and written communication skills Strong interpersonal and leadership skills Proven analytical and quality improvement ability Demonstrated proficiency in repair troubleshooting, shop operations, and testing of jet engines Ability to make formal presentations to all audiences Ability to work with all levels of maintenance, engineering, and management Project management and Lean 6 Sigma / Green Belt experience Demonstrated ability to lead and influence customer and peers Fluent in English – proficiency in local language A&P or LAME certification Humble: respectful, receptive, agile, eager to learn Transparent: shares critical information, speaks with candor, contributes constructively Focused: quick learner, strategically prioritizes work, committed Leadership ability: strong communicator, decision-maker, collaborative Problem solver: analytical-minded, challenges existing processes, critical thinker Additional Information Relocation Assistance Provided: Yes

Job number SG12058 Work Location Bendemeer Parkway Shenton Contract Type Permanent Closing Date 14-Mar-2022 Country Singapore The Role To build and lead our ecommerce team to deliver our ambition of growing our B2C eCommerce business from 0% to 5% in 3 years. This person is highly strategic as well and very hands-on and has demonstrated a track record of successfully growing online business. Key responsibilities include providing strategic leadership, delivering the eCommerce platform and overseeing the entire eCommerce operations. Principal Accountabilities: 1. Comprehend the overall digital business strategic intent and identify potential eCommerce business opportunities through a deep understanding of buyers’ and internal business’ needs. 2. Develop and own the business plan to grow the ecommerce business from 0% to 5% of revenue in 3 years. The plan should Include business revenue and profitability modelling and product implementation roadmap (features, solutions, or services). 3. Builds and directs a team of professionals that can effectively help develop and execute ecommerce solutions in tandem with growth projection based on said ecommerce business plan. 4. Own Ecommerce P&L and performance vs Budget. Including full responsibility for the website and platform. 5. Define the ecommerce platform product requirements and roadmap (features, solutions or services) that users value. This includes defining the business case, user flows, the budget required, specific operational requirements and seeking approvals for product implementation 6. Technical responsibility will sit under the IT department team who will provide solutions, sourcing and manage all technical aspects of the ecommerce platform. 7. Responsible for an overall communication plan, evangelising, training, and driving platform adoption internally by working with relevant business units. 8. Drive the implementation of the ecommerce workflow by working and collaborating with both internal partners and external vendors. This will include leading the cross-functional implementation team (marketing, IT, Operations) through the onboarding of products to product definition and integration to current business processes that deliver a superior shopping experience. 9. Responsible to define the marketing plan to bring traffic to the site. Working with the marketing team to establish market leadership in the eCommerce business by strategizing campaigns and promoting ROI goals. This scope involves content creation, SEO, printed and electronic marketing promotional material, product training, and relevant supporting documents/papers. 10. Act as point of the first reference for all ecommerce related enquiries and work collaboratively with colleagues in IT, Hospital Operations, Business development, Business Analytics, etc. to address any issues that may arise. 11. Track and report on progress and successes via relevant KPIs and business metrics. Design survey and gather user attitude towards products, feedbacks and other needs to drive continuous program enhancements. 12. Quality and development of the Ecommerce customer experience. Working in partnership with other departments heads – especially Marketing, internal business units, customer support and service excellence team. Key accountabilities 1. Annual eCommerce revenue and profit targets 2. eCommerce product launch timeliness 3. Adoption by internal and external merchants. 4. VOC metrics: Quality of the eCommerce customer experience – reflected in customer feedback, stakeholder feedback and performance vs industry benchmarks. 5. Team performance and development are reflected in commercial performance and feedback. Qualifications & Experience • Graduate degree with at least 8-10 years of relevant Marketing, Product development, or project management experience. • Must be a seasoned professional that has demonstrated a track record of successfully growing a b2C online business. • Must have extensive knowledge of eCommerce technologies and tactics, especially in commerce experience management, digital asset management, and digital shelf analytics. Additional Information Conceptual/Process Skills • Being able to define and refine the problem and think out-of-the-box for solutions. • Analytical, meticulous, methodical and able to pin down blue sky concepts into implementable products • Must demonstrate strong business judgment and decision-making skills. People skills • Excellent interpersonal, facilitation, note-taking and writing skills • Proficient with Microsoft Office suites of products • Skilled in eCommerce technologies and tactics • Able to bring in the right cross-functional people and inspire the team to deliver stellar service to demanding customers. Technical Skills • Must be a self-described data expert with the ability to interpret data and draw conclusions to implement new ecommerce strategies. • Advance reporting tools (Power BI and Firebase Analytics) experience

Location: Supreme Court Lane, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179803, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description The Singapore Academy of Law (“SAL”) is a promotion and development agency for Singapore’s legal industry. Our vision is to make Singapore the legal hub of Asia. The Singapore Mediation Centre (“SMC”) is a subsidiary of the Academy. Established in 1997, SMC pioneered the use of mediation as the mainstream mechanism for dispute resolution, as well as training in negotiation and conflict management. Today, SMC offers a suite of alternative dispute resolution services which brings clarity and objectivity to complex situations. These services include mediation, adjudication, neutral evaluation and domain name dispute resolution. Through our panel of professional mediators with legal and industry expertise, SMC is well-placed to manage difficult negotiations and unlock standstills for businesses by providing cost-effective and timely solutions. At SMC, our vision is to help all businesses fully appreciate the value of mediation as a strategic risk-management tool that they can count on in commercial dealings. Responsibilities: You will support the administration of cases by managing the financial aspects of case files that are administered by SMC’s Registry team. This includes, but not limited to, SMC’s core services for Mediation and Adjudication. You will require familiarity with using SMC’s inhouse enterprise resource planning software – Business Central – to create customer cards, input data and generate invoicing (including e-invoicing) for case files. You will be required to liaise closely with the Finance department on invoicing, receipts, and other financial aspects between SMC’s Registry team and the Finance department. You may also be required to undertake other ad hoc duties in relation to the financial aspects of case files as and when required (e.g. collection and dispatch of cheques/documents). Requirements: Have familiarity with Business Central and MS Office. Be meticulous and organized, possess initiative, and are able to multitask to meet deadlines. Preferably have work experience related to Finance and/or Accounting. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Job_Title: Production Operators [$2200 - $2600 + OT + Shift allowances/ Boon Lay]
Job_Descriptions: Job Responsibilities: Handle raw material, weighing balances and other manufacturing equipment, including basic warehouse handling equipment such as pallet truck and electric stacker, as part of the manu-facturing activities requirement. Manufacture finished goods in accordance to specific process steps and standard operation procedures (SOP) in an efficient, precise and accurate manner. Perform to meet daily production target and capable of responding to overtime when neces-sary. Observe and practice personal hygiene and good manufacturing practices in all manufactur-ing processes. Act as an oversight for product quality on both raw materials and finished goods and identify any issues that may affect production. Ensure cosmetic and functional checks are performing on critical control points as part of food safety requirement. Perform packing and palletising of finished goods, both manually and through use of ma-chineries. Monitored and recorded process variables such as levels, flows, temperatures and pressures as required by the manufacturing process. Ensure the production inventory and all materials are well maintained in accordance to the in-ventory plan. Perform cleaning of used-equipment in accordance to SOP and perform post-cleaning checks to ensure no possibility of cross-contamination due to residual content. Perform cross-functional production activities when tasked. Practise safe and healthy working behaviour and communicate on all observed hazards and safety non-compliances. Participate as a core participant in Productivity Improvement Team and practice productivi-ty/process improvement methodologies such as 5S, COQ, Kaizen or Six Sigma. Perform additional tasked roles as part of the corporate requirements. Meet with co-workers, supervisors, engineers and managers to ensure production activity re-quirements meet corporate standards and consumer expectations. Participate as a team on fostering a culture of safety, quality and operational excellence. Jobs Requirements: Nitec or Diploma in Chemical Process Technology, Engineering, Food Technology or related field 4 years working experience with at least 2 years in manufacturing environment. Experience working with weighing balance and warehousing equipment such as pallet truck and electric stackers. Experience with HACCP, cGMP or ISO22000 systems Able to adapt and respond to changes in environment and priorities Team player Self-discipline and able to comply to SOPs and company guidelines

Job_Title: Consumer Business Operational Risk & Control, Strategy & Execution
Job_Descriptions: The Compl Bus Control Sr Manager accomplishes results through the management of professional team(s) and department(s). Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Contributes to standards around which others will operate. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the entire function. Requires basic commercial awareness. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Has responsibility for volume, quality, timeliness and delivery of end results of an area. May have responsibility for planning, budgeting and policy formulation within area of expertise. Involved in short-term planning resource planning. Full management responsibility of a team, which may include management of people, budget and planning, to include duties such as performance evaluation, compensation, hiring, disciplinary and terminations and may include budget approval. Responsibilities: Manage and drive the incident management process from Start to Finish. Produce the weekly Incident Management Report communicated with all senior leaders in supported Lines of Business. Facilitates and ensures Issue Management Quality Standards are met for issues documented Act as the Single point of Contact for issue metrics. Transform raw data into useful metrics and reportable information for senior leadership. Develops and produces issue and incident metrics for Senior Leadership on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis. Perform quality assurance over issues being reported on multiple executive level reports to include Monthly Operations Decks and Weekly Control Decks. Leverage communication and influencing skills to guide issue and corrective action plan owners and issue managers during times of distress during the issue management process. Keeps abreast of the organization's operational processes and best practices for business strategy. Build partnerships with supported Line of Businesses Operations leaders, process owners, client experience leaders, control leaders, and Training, so that efforts are aligned with strategy and department efforts, regular two-way communication exists, downstream impacts are considered and business solutions are optimized. Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision. Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy. Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members. Ability to manage teams. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards. Qualifications: Ability to run and manage conference calls with business partners, technology and functional peers from multiple disciplines to reach a common goal. Prefer experience of Transactions Services functional knowledge Proficient with the iCAP system, experience with Cognos is a plus. 6-10 years of experience Education: Bachelor's/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree VP - CBORC Strategy & Execution Job Purpose: The Consumer Business Risk and Control (CBORC) Strategy & Execution VP role is a seasoned change & transformation role, professionally contributing to change, transformation as well as the development of new techniques and enhancement of processes & controls for the business or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates complex and variable issues with potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Strong communication and stakeholder management skills are required. Direct reporting line to GCB CBORC Strategy & Execution Head. Job_Title: Analyst/Senior Analyst/Associate - Futures Operations, Commodities and Global Markets
Job_Descriptions: We are seeking an experienced dynamic professional to join our futures team. As a Futures Operations Associate you will oversee the daily operation of our SGX Clearing Membership and reconciliations for the global exchanges that we clear. In this role, you will be responsible for the daily operation of our SGX Clearing Membership and reconciliations for the global exchanges that we clear. You will be posting trade allocations and clearing for all SGX trades in addition to performing T+1 trade amendments and give ups. You will also be monitoring all trades booked to suspense / holding and average price accounts and ensure timely escalation. You will play an important role in regulatory reporting, including submission of reports to SGX and MAS. You will also be responsible for investigating and resolving SGX breaks raised by our Sydney team. Operational excellence is vital to our business and you will provide the highest level of operational support and service to the business. You will ensure that procedures are up to date and reviewed on a periodic basis. You will continuously review/monitor workflow and strive for efficiencies in time, costs and service levels. You will also be required to work on operations related projects and will need to be able to influence and manage stakeholders accordingly whilst driving projects through to completion. You need to have extensive knowledge of SGX, SGX clearing & settlement systems, SGX exchange rules and SFA (MAS) regulations gained from working in a similar position for at least 5 years. You will also need to have a strong control and process orientated mindset and be constantly aware of the regulatory framework in which we operate. You need to have good communication skills, happy to work with both senior stakeholders and support junior members of the team. Strong Excel skills (e.g. macros) and Access are required along with an excellent attention to detail. This role could require shift work and work on public holidays. However, we facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available. If you are ready for a new and exciting challenge, we look forward to hearing from you. About Commodities and Global Markets Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities. Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of 'empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future' is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways. We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

Job_Title: Manager, Grp AML Policy & Advisory, Group Compliance
Job_Descriptions: Manager, Grp AML Policy & Advisory, Group Compliance Posting Date: 12-Feb-2022 Location: SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Compliance function is a strategic partner and a trusted business enabler to the Board and senior management. It is our responsibility to ensure that the Group continuously fulfils its regulatory obligations in today's tight and dynamic regulatory landscape. To do that, we work closely with internal stakeholders to identify and to assess regulatory risks. This collaboration also includes developing practical solutions that integrate regulations into operational requirements as well as actively shaping and promoting stronger compliance culture and literacy in the Bank. Job Responsibilities The successful candidate will be part of the Group Compliance, AML Advisory team and the key responsibilities are as follows: • As the subject matter expert, this individual will provide advice/collaborate with Business and AML Business Compliance officers in the development of AML controls, processes and procedures to ensure risks are effectively identified and mitigated. • Reviews and contributes to the maintenance of Group AML/CFT policies and procedures to ensure its effectiveness and relevancy to laws, regulations and best practices. • Provide consistent advice, interpretation and implementation of Group AML/CFT procedure. • Provide key updates on AML/CFT related matters to the respective business forums and committees. • Work alongside Business and Business Compliance Officer in the management of AML/CFT controls and risk • Monitors development on related AML/CFT laws, regulations and risk trends • Handles MAS, internal and external audits. • Provide support and participate in AML/regulatory-related projects. • Any other support as required by the Group Head of AML from time to time. Job Requirements • Degree or professional qualification in business or banking/financial services related areas • Has minimum 3 years of relevant work experience preferably in AML/CFT/Sanction compliance function • Excellent research skill including experience with online research tools and databases • Good knowledge/understanding of banking and financial services laws & regulations, compliance best practices and understanding of financial products & systems • Ability to work effectively, under pressure, in a rapid changing environment, as well as autonomously and as an effective member of a dynamic team • A team player, strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills • Possesses good analytical and problem-solving skills • Able to work on multiple assignments • Self-driven, meticulous and able to operate expeditiously • Having a professional AML-related certification is an advantage Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. Job_Title: Global Transaction Services Techno Senior Business Analyst
Job_Descriptions: The role will be part of the Global Transaction Services Technology (GTST) APAC team. GTST is a technology service delivery organization supporting the Global Banking and Markets business in Asia Pacific. The Bank is embarking on a multi-year core banking transformation journey to replace its legacy core banking platform with modern technology platforms. As part of the core banking platform transformation, the bank will seek opportunities to revamp & improve its end to end ecosystem to improve operational & technological efficiency. The core banking platforms support multiple functions in Global Banking and Markets business: e.g. payments, deposits, credit, trade finance, foreign exchange, general ledger. The candidate will be a senior product and techno-functional expert, and will play a leadership role in the banking transformation program. He/She will work with product teams, technical leads, and vendor SMEs for a given work stream (e.g. payments, trade finance) under the core banking transformation program and will have direct accountability in ensuring that business requirements for the work stream are designed and implemented as per expectation. The role is expected to build a deep understanding of the core banking platform and the capability it offers, and play a leadership role in solution ideation, design, and delivery. The role is required to work closely with business, operations, vendor partners and various peer groups/stakeholders in technology. The Position: Work with business, operations, and technology teams to gather requirements and recommend the optimal way to implement the solution in the product. Organize/Facilitate vendor demos to evaluate tools and solutions that may be adopted. Provide leadership and guidance on functional and technical aspects of the solution. Leverage domain and product expertise to set direction and drive project execution. Foresee and proactively address risks, issues, and dependencies. Act as the liaison between vendor and internal teams on requirements and oversee their end-to-end implementation. Manage user queries during feature implementation, and ensure that they are tracked and closed. Participate in system design, SIT, and UAT to ensure that solutions are being delivered and tested as per requirements. Ensure knowledge sharing and training on new product features. Recommend and implement data migration and integration strategies. Develop the Day-1 Operating model and support its implementation post go live. The Candidate: Essential Skills (Technical / Business Domain / Managerial/ Soft skills) Sound knowledge of the Wholesale Banking domain: e.g. deposits, payments, receivables, liquidity management, trade finance, commercial loans, credit management, FX. Experience in Core Banking transformation, and in designing core banking solutions that fit into a complex product ecosystem. Experience working with product and service vendors, and with the onshore-offshore delivery model. Ability to drive senior level discussions with good presentation and communication skills. Ability to influence & work with regional and global partners/stakeholders to drive the program forward. Execution and result oriented. Aptitude for critical thinking, problem solving, and decision-making. Desired Skills (Technical / Domain / Managerial/ Language Skills) Finacle implementation expertise. Knowledge of Finacle Core modules and the Finacle data model. Knowledge of Finacle Scripting and Finacle Workflows. Familiarity with Asia Banking market practices For more information you can email Duncan Gage in our Singapore office on quoting Job Reference 523619 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. Job_Title: Head - APAC ICG Ops Risk & Control
Job_Descriptions: The APAC ICG Operations Risk and Control Head will report to the Global Head of Markets Operations Control and will be responsible for driving the Risk and Control framework and Governance across the Operations organization. This role will manage a team of OTCR officers and will work in close partnership the Risk & Control Officers for individual Operations functional areas and business functions to assess the risk profile of processes and develop a robust risk framework that pro-actively identifies and mitigates emerging risks. The role is also expected to bring thought leadership to the business. The role is a single point connect for Global leadership to get a regional view of all Operations risk and controls with associated remediation activities in support of APAC region. It interfaces with 2nd and 3rd line of defenses and ICG Operations Management to review and assess the overall control environment and any required remediation. Key job function is proactively evaluating processes to ensure that internal controls framework implemented is working and risks are mitigated for all of ICG Ops functions, corporate policies, and regulatory requirements along with reporting and escalating significant control events. The individual must have an excellent understanding of Operations and associated functional units and how these contribute to achieving the objectives of the business. The individual must have a good understanding of the industry and the control challenges. Excellent communication skills are required in order to articulate internally issues, action plans, etc., often at a senior level. Some external communication/negotiation may be necessary. The individual will have full management responsibility for multiple teams, including management of people to include duties such as performance evaluation, compensation, hiring, disciplinary actions and terminations. The individual may also be involved or responsible for diverse (cross-discipline) activities. Responsibilities: Establishes and oversees the application of operational risk policies, technology and tools, and governance processes to create lasting solutions for minimizing losses from failed internal processes, inadequate controls, and emerging risks. Works with colleagues in other areas of Risk Management, Finance, Compliance/Control and the Businesses to assure appropriate management of Operational Risk processes: Facilitates accurate and appropriate reporting of operational risks to senior management and BRCC members. Promotes the use of risk indicators. Identifies emerging operational risks in the context of the current economic, regulatory and business environment and assure that measures are being taken to mitigate these risks. Analyses operational risk data (typically losses, metrics or assessment results) to identify areas of excessive risk and to ensure that mitigation efforts are having the desired effect(s). Investigates causes for metrics that are deviating from trends and escalate situations that pose excessive risk(s). Works closely with Control officers to identify root causes of major internal losses and ensure actions are taken to reduce the risk of loss from similar causes. Upholds the Operational Risk Policy: Ensures Operations adhere to Policies, applies sound ethical judgment regarding personal behaviour, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as work with Control Officers to effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards. Qualifications: 15+ years relevant experience Experienced in Operations & Operational Risk. Knowledge of other risk disciplines (market risk, credit risk) a plus. Demonstrated analytical ability; asks insightful questions, break analytical challenges into workable components and draws meaningful conclusions. Well versed in breaking down complex matters into core issues and root causes that can be more readily addressed. Proficient in developing new ideas to mitigate risk and improve current processes. Prioritizes high impact potential problems effectively. Consistently reads different situations accurately and takes appropriate action to gain senior colleague/ client commitment. Articulates clearly how risk technology supports unit's business, as well as the issues due to gaps between the current technology and known business requirements. Ability to measure and assess the impact of stress shocks including fat-tailed risks. Well-versed in reviewing the dimensions of franchise risk. Advanced Leadership skills Operates as a leader, with an understanding and appreciation for diverse backgrounds. Education: Bachelor's/University degree, Master's degree preferred and managerial experience Job Family Group: Risk Management Job Family: Operational Risk Time Type: Full time Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Cloud allows us to be location-agnostic, ubiquitous, scalable according to needs. By embarking on a cloud-first strategy, we have the means to deliver our network, serve our customers, improve efficiencies and embrace new business opportunities through greater API connectivity. We target more than half of our compute workloads for core banking and trading systems, and new innovations, to be cloud-based by 2025, subject to regulatory approvals. All new systems are now built for the cloud, utilising modern compute paradigms and architectures that are container-based and service-based. We're looking for talented individuals in their early careers who are passionate about technology and customer experience, and we value specialised expertise. You'll also be put through Standard Chartered's Cloud Engineering Programme by aXess Academy . We have developed an exciting 5 weeks programme designed to fast track and enable you to build the skillsets necessary to be cloud-ready. This includes structured learning pathways in areas such as Agile, Cloud Computing, Cloud Services, Security, DevOps and Cloud Migration. You will follow a tailored training and development plan where you will have exposure to senior leaders and other technologists across the bank as well as learn more about Standard Chartered and how we operate, apply and adopt technologies with business. Post the Cloud Engineering Programme, your role responsibilities will cover: Implement a state-of-the-art platform to enable our customers to gain a faster time to market Be recognised as trusted partner for business application owners and other technology teams who seek to make use of Cloud based infrastructure Provide technical design expertise to application and delivery teams Introduce & support emerging technology and best market practices to ensure consistent and state of the art systems are built and business achieves enhanced benefits As a Cloud Engineer your role may vary depending upon the vertical you serve as: Cloud Security Engineer Systems Engineer (Cloud) Cloud Developer Cloud Architect Network Engineer (Cloud) Special responsibility for: Ensuring that platform conforms to Standard Chartered security best practises and is fully consistent with Bank audit and compliance requirements and fully consistent with the design ethos and technical requirements of external cloud providers Full-Stack development Software testing during deployment cycles Architectural design and continuous improvement of the platform adhering to regulator and compliance requirements Supporting adoption of containers and container control frameworks for external and internal Cloud Services, including container platform selection and design, cost and license planning and ensuring that self-service design/deployment/control web containers is appropriate for requirements Ensure lifecycle management consists of documentation such as test cases, source code repositories etc are actively used and maintained Perform other duties as assigned or required Our Ideal Candidate Studied Computer Science, Computer Engineering or relevant disciplines in software design and development or with coding knowledge. Should have some knowledge in Cloud Technologies. Advantages if you have Cloud certifications. Some working experience with one or more general purpose programming languages like Python, Golang, etc. Ability to articulate and explain concepts and ideas contextually and visually. Good technical skills, IT skills, good verbal and written communication skills and good organizational skills. Good problem-solving skills and team player Role Specific Technical Competencies 1+ years of experience in Cloud Technologies (ie: AWS/Azure). Advantages if you have Cloud certifications. Containerization and container platforms like - Kubernetes- architecture and implementation One or more general purpose programming languages like Python, Golang, etc. DevOps tools - such as Git, Jenkins and Infrastructure as code using Terraform and ansible Cyber security fundamentals Linux fundamentals Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. Job_Title: Global Wealth Management Asia Platform Adoption Head.
Job_Descriptions: The Strategy Senior Group Manager manages multiple teams through other managers. In-depth understanding of how own sub-function contributes to achieving the objectives of the function. A good understanding of the industry, direct competitors' products and services, is also necessary in order to contribute to the commercial objectives of the business. Requires thorough understanding of strategic direction of the function within the relevant part of the business, combined with a solid conceptual/practical grounding in both the function and/or area of expertise and related subject areas. Excellent communication skills required in order to negotiate internally, often at a senior level. Some external communication/negotiation may be necessary. Responsible for executing functional strategy in area managed. Determines approach to implementing functional strategy. Accountable for end results, budgeting, planning, policy formulation and contribution to future strategy of the area(s). Impact reflects size of team managed, strategic influence on the business and interaction with other functions or businesses. Full management responsibility for multiple teams, including management of people, budget and planning, to include duties such as performance evaluation, compensation, hiring, disciplinary actions and terminations and budget approval. May be doing involved or responsible for diverse (cross-discipline) activities. Typically, a direct report to a C16 role and function as an integral member of the functional leadership team within a country/site location, job family, or line of business. Key Responsibilities: Work closely with CGW leadership team to define and deliver the technology product roadmaps aligning to strategic business priorities. Prioritize and manage annual technology investments of over USD 60MM. Work in close collaboration with the product, sales and segments regional and country teams to understand and anticipate business needs and translate them into technology product requirements. Work closely with CGW & GCB technology teams to oversee all stages of product creation including design and development. Lead the planning product release plans and set the expectation for delivery of new functionalities. Spearhead the Technology strategy and prioritization conversation with Global CGW COO Team Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of Release/Sprint Goals Create and maintain a product backlog according to business value or ROI. Ensure customer launch of implemented technologies and drive adoption. Create pragmatic frameworks for measuring business value of implemented technology - iterate on roadmap basis the results. Analyze market, the users, and the roadmap for the product; follow competitors and industry Requirements: In-depth understanding of Wealth products and Wealth Management business Good understanding of technology processes Outstanding communication, presentation and leadership skills Excellent organizational and team management experience Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills Education: Bachelor's/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree Responsibilities: Acts as a trusted advisor to the leadership team and addresses high impact strategic issues across its portfolio of businesses. Work in close partnership with business heads and senior leadership. Lead the strategic planning process based on fact based analysis. Guide and execute analysis of our markets, competitors, and customers using internal and external resources. Drive corporate strategy initiatives around growth, investments, capital and expense optimization. Conduct organic growth initiative development and prioritization, and portfolio assessment. Identify opportunities and issues of strategic importance to Business Units. Develop recommendations to advise Citi's senior management on high-priority initiatives, including growth strategy, product and segment strategies, and cross business initiatives. Support performance measurement and management ranging from strategic franchise development scorecards to project/function-specific metrics. Coordinate communications with key internals (e.g. Citi executive leadership and Board) and external stakeholders (e.g. investor community, regulators). Actively recruit and develop team members, including placement out of the Strategy function into other roles. Develop transformational strategies to grow and re-position businesses. Provide clarity in complex problems, facilitate decision-making, and guide high value investments. Develop and strengthen relationships with executives across the business. Contribute to continuous team improvement and management, e.g., provide leadership in recruiting, coach junior staff, etc. Management responsibility for a team or multiple teams, including management of people, budget and planning, performance evaluation, compensation, hiring, disciplinary actions and terminations and budget approval. Performs other duties and functions as assigned. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards. Qualifications: 10+ years experience in people management. 15+ years relevant experience in strategy consulting. Previous project management experience: project planning & execution, client and team member management. In-depth understanding of the business and financial drivers. Ability to lead and direct a team of knowledge professionals. Problem structuring and analytic capabilities; ability to take a complex problem and organize it in discrete pieces for solution. Ability to size and prioritize large-scale initiatives across businesses. Ability to work effectively with senior and middle level managers and with large interdisciplinary teams. Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication Problem structuring & causal thinking, sound business judgment, and demonstrated result orientation. Outstanding analytical and quantitative capabilities; history of academic and professional excellence and achievement. Creativity thinking; thinks outside the box and challenges conventional wisdom. Collaborative work style; effectively interacts with partners across organizational boundaries/hierarchies. Displays a leadership presence; commands respect and will earn trust of senior leaders. Multi-tasks productively and reliably, while managing conflicting priorities. Business builder capable of creating vision and motivating a geographically dispersed team. Proven track record of successfully managing a complex business with Profit and Loss (P&L) management experience. Good understanding of the different banking products. About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Make an impact every day with Trust, Data and Resilience (TDR) Our TDR team sits within the Group Operations function and is responsible for mission-critical areas including cyber, information, data, privacy and resilience. These are challenges that impact our clients globally. Our TDR team develops the platforms, drives the processes and builds partnerships to benefit millions of people every day. The team thrives in providing solutions to complex issues, devote time and energy to designing new and innovative solutions, and all in an environment that demands being risk-aware, not risk-averse. TDR chooses progress over perfection and aims to always participate with a constructive purpose. The team makes an impact wherever they are based, be it in our offices around the world, our Global Business Solution centres in China, India, Malaysia and Poland, or even from our home. Now you have an opportunity to make a meaningful impact with a diverse and passionate team of creators, innovators and achievers. With us, you'll learn, be inspired, and make an impact every day. The success of our work hinges on how we use the unique diversity of our people to realise the effects we seek to achieve: Always on. Always safe. Always Simple. TDR Training and Awareness The TDR Training and Awareness (T&A) team is responsible for fostering a data-ready, security-aware and resilient culture that protects the Bank and our clients from data breaches. It does this through creating risk-based, targeted campaigns for ICS, Data and Privacy, Resilience and 3 rd Party Risk, to drive behaviour change amongst employees, executives, high risk roles, third parties and customers. The ultimate goal of the T&A team is to reduce and manage the risk of a breach of Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of the Bank's information assets to within the Bank's risk appetite. The team achieves this goal through driving the design, development, deployment and enablement of delivery via virtual, instructor-led, and digital campaigns, enabled by global awareness communities of practice, based on employees' roles and risk types. Their remit spans general employee awareness, role-based training, executive engagement, phishing awareness and simulation exercises, field enablement, communications, assessing and remediating behaviour change, T&A risk reporting, operations and strategy, as well as TDR Skills Academies and Global Outreach. We are looking for a seasoned cyber security training and awareness professional to lead a team to create engaging and effective campaigns for bank-wide and targeted audiences, and has a deep understanding of the intricacies of human behaviour and habits that drive behavioural change. Main Purpose of Role: The ICS Campaigns & Culture Lead will design, develop and ensure delivery of campaigns and learning materials for Bank employees, targeted high risk roles, and customers/clients. This includes managing our Bank-wide cyber fundamentals e-learning module, as well as wider campaigns and training activities. The successful candidate will be responsible for strategy and creative concepts, drafting of key campaigns, messages and communications, and working with the T&A Deploy and Deliver Team to ensure the successful deployment and delivery of campaigns through our Communities of Practice and Heads of ICS They will use insights from our Voice of the Customer surveys, Go-To-Market reports and Threat Intelligence data to ensure the key threats and risks are remediated, and appropriately tracked and reported. This role will ensure that all campaigns align with our adult learning and go to market principles. They should be compatible and appropriate for all countries across our global footprint and consider how different communities absorb knowledge and cultural sensitivities. Candidate will ensure compliance with the latest policy and standards, as well as liaising with the TDR T&A Operations and Reporting team, and TDR Threat Intelligence Team to identify and address emerging threats in a storytelling approach to help our employees understand, recall and behave securely in their day-to-day lives. The ICS Campaigns & Culture Lead will be an ambassador for the Trust, Data & Resilience Team; and a credible and engaging presenter, able to talk confidently internally and externally on ICS culture and awareness. They must be able to convey technical information in a non-technical way. This role will appeal to someone who has proven expertise in creating engaging, gamified and innovative content, and who is passionate about human behaviour and nudge theory. They will have hands on experience in designing threat-based awareness programmes, in line with industry frameworks, that directly drive down the human aspect of ICS risk. Preference will be given to an individual who can engage with audiences at all levels and roll their sleeves up and deliver on the ground training and awareness activities with our Communities of Practice and Heads of ICS. Key responsibilities: Bank-wide Campaigns Design and develop memorable campaigns to embed strong secure behaviours that trigger understanding and or action, such as reporting incidents, not clicking on malicious links and attachments, and creating strong passwords, via engaging and impactful initiatives. Design and develop innovative digital and virtual face-to-face methods of engaging employees. Work with the team and key stakeholders (for example the Heads of ICS, Threat Intelligence, and the Cyber Defence Centre) to form and develop the key messages for each campaign. Work with the TDR T&A team to create storylines for every campaign. Lead on copywriting to help tell impactful stories - triggering the desired behaviour and action Create new/fresh/industry best practice campaigns that align with our Go-To-Market principles High Risk Roles (HRR) / Targeted Training (TT): Partner with T&A team and key stakeholders (eg: Heads of ICS, T&A Operations and Reporting, Threat Intelligence, and the Cyber Defence Centre) to form and develop the required messaging based on risks and behaviour gaps Develop TT strategies to shape and inform the design, development and delivery of TT for select audiences, including through conducting needs analysis, E2E journey mapping and conversations with key stakeholders across the Bank. Design and develop learning materials such as e-learning modules, videos, comms, and instructor-led training sessions to help raise awareness of ICS and related risks (eg: Data and Privacy, Operational Resilience, Third Party) among the Bank's targeted audiences and high risk roles. This includes, but is not limited to, People Leaders, Board/MT members, repeat clickers, new joiners and other roles as defined in the end to end awareness process. Ensure all targeted campaigns and content address emerging threats and remediate gaps identified by; regulatory, audit and, control testing activities' while meeting business needs . Collaborate with T&A Deploy and Deliver team, People Capability and Learning Operations teams to ensure the successful deployment and delivery of targeted training content. Track and manage the deployment and delivery of the campaigns, identifying blockers and impediments to enable early intervention and to meet targets on time and within budget. Work with the Head, GTM and Operations and Reporting team to track reach, frequency, behaviour change and programme effectiveness, and use data as inputs to the campaign planning cycle. Strategy, planning and risk management Adhere to and uphold the Training & Awareness strategy and planning process, to help ensure the team's continued transformation. Support the team's agility by responding to new business intelligence, new threats, and requests from key stakeholders to deliver campaign objectives and remain focused on buying down human risk Define, monitor, and publish key performance metrics and key control indicators to measure campaign effectiveness. Showcase campaign successes and opportunities for improvement that clearly demonstrate behavioural change and help foster a robust security culture. Demonstrate that the awareness programme is addressing the right risks, meeting clear awareness objectives and delighting audiences. Help to embed the Training & Awareness Team charter and "how we do things around here" commitments across the portfolio. Voice of the Customer Feed into Voice of the Customer activities by providing key questions to ascertain the effectiveness of campaigns. Build-in Voice of the Customer feedback into the campaign design process to ensure the team's continued transformation to meet the needs of the customer ..... click apply for full job details

We're looking for a Lead, Data Scientist to work onsite within our Digital Bank. We're a small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams. As a Lead, Data Scientist, you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working, and build delightful high quality products for our customers. Job Description Reporting to the Head of Data & Insights, you will join a multidisciplinary team to work on and solve many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working and build delightful high-quality products for our customers. We are looking for a Lead, Data Scientist for our Digital Bank in Singapore who can analyse large amount of raw information to derive insights to improve our company. We will also rely on you to build and improve data products with machine learning models. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. You will also be familiar with the agile practices and working in sprints with other data scientists and data engineers bring data use cases to life. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with high degrees of ambiguity, get excited by solving complex problems and are happy to roll your sleeves up and get things done. The Role Responsibility: • Build/implement enterprise level Data Hub, Dashboard/Reporting platform, Machine Learning environment, Analytics (Adobe, Google) with relevant stakeholders • Run and execute those platforms: o By creating predictive models and machine-learning algorithms for propensity to buy, churn prevention o By building and maintaining the behavioural segmentation o By delivering the dashboards and reports that make data actionable • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of data sources and data gathering techniques. • Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis • Extending company's data with third party sources of information when needed • Crunch, mine and analyse data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies. • Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, other business outcomes. • Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy. • Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner • Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance • Analyse large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns • Present information using data visualization techniques • Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges • Present proposals and results in a clear manner backed by data and coupled with actionable conclusions. Our Ideal Candidate: • 8-10 years of experience in manipulating data sets and building statistical models, ideally within a high growth Start up or within Financial services, with a Retail or Consumer banking focus. • Possesses a Master's or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field. • Experience in creating data architectures and ML frameworks. • Experience with a variety of machine learning techniques (supervised, unsupervised, anomaly detection, deep learning, NLP, RecSys etc) and understanding their real-world advantages / drawbacks. • Proven experience as a Data Scientist with past history of successfully delivering end-to-end data science projects (business understanding, EDA, modelling, deployment, monitoring, etc). • Experience using data science related languages/tools (Python, SQL, Spark, R etc) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. • Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Domo, Tableau, Data Studio) and data frameworks (e.g. Google Big Query, Big Table, Data Flow) • Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, S3, Lambda, Sagemaker, EC2, etc) • Problem-solving aptitude • Have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. • Excellent communication and presentation skills • Experience in Agile ways of working and familiarity with tools like Jira, Confluence, Trello, Slack etc
