Location: Jtc Launchpad @ One-North, Queenstown, Singapore, Central Region
Job_Descriptions: Job Description We are looking to host solution-minded student to embark their internship journey with us. Here’s your chance to create a journey with us. Come join our medical start-up. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is a medical start-up developing an advanced machine vision tracking system for the management of Overactive Bladder (OAB). Our goal is to design and develop a proprietary diagnostic tool to analyze real-time images of the bladder. The diagnostic tool will help pinpoint unusual muscle group activity to help in the treatment of OAB. We need passionate and flexible engineers to grow with us. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is incubated by Trendlines Medical Singapore Pte Ltd. Project Name: Deep-Learning architecture development involving 2D and 1D vascular datasets such as specklegram / photoplethysmogram biosignals for polymorphic determination in cardiometabolic diseases Background: Worldwide, a third of adults suffer from some form of Cardiovascular disease (CVD) which annually contribute to the deaths of 17.7 million people globally, accounting for 31% of total deaths. In comparison, the combined annual deaths resulting from HIV/Aids, malaria, and tuberculosis combined only amount to 3.86 million. Hypertension affects at least 25% of the global adult population and is the most common cause of CVD-related deaths due to associated secondary pathologies. There is also a significant association of hypertension with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) with hypertension being twice as frequent in diabetic sufferers compared to non-diabetics. By 2050, Singapore projects that there will be 1 million sufferers of diabetes, accounting for 10% of the disease burden in Singapore. Disease prediction solely from genotyping has resulted in poor associations due to unexpected multi-nomic interactions. Scope: This project proposal seeks to apply advanced Machine Learning (ML) or Deep Learning (DL) algorithms on 1D/2D datasets to identify potential pleiotropic relationships in cardiometabolic diseases. We will also evaluate the predictive performance and accuracy of various AI-ML algorithms. The objective is to develop an advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) architecture extracting critical features from the pulsatile morphology of 1-Dimensional PPG signals or 2D vascular videos to form an adaptive numerical model of an individual. Due difficulty in acquiring real-world biosignal datasets, novel techniques will need to be implemented to address the limited data available for training such as autonomous semi-supervised neural network designs. The project will involve 1D/2D signal processing and deep learning and will require strong knowledge in Python programming. Job_Title: Business Development Manager, Synthetics [$8,000 -$9,000 basic + Commission + Allowances /Suntec]
Job_Descriptions: Position summary As Business Development Manager Synthetics, you are responsible for growing our Synthetics Business in Asia North / South-East Asia. You translate the overall long-term synthetic segment strategies into an annual regional sales plan. Through development of new, and ongoing contacts with existing customers, you ensure execution of the annual sales plan in terms of volume and margin. You set-up commercial partnerships that will accelerate growth You provide accurate sales forecasts and updates You follow up on specific technical support and you organize / commercialize our services offering You build in depth product and application knowledge. You continuously monitor the target market, the evolution of customer priorities and competitor activities. You are the main contact with clients and therefore are first in line to capture clients’ needs. You forward this information internally to play an active role in the product and/or application development and synthetics segment strategies. You report to the Regional Commercial Director Ropes and work closely with the General Manager Synthetics. In addition, you collaborate with the Innovation, the Customer service and Operations Teams. Travel is needed; up to 25% of your time you visit customers and prospects in your region. Candidate profile University degree in engineering, commercial engineering or business management. Minimum of five years business development / marketing & sales experience in a B2B context, preferably but not necessarily in the Synthetics Ropes business and/or one of the segments in which we are active (off shore, crane & industrial). Background in international business management, international customer-supplier relationship, general business law and contracts as well as international trade practices and regulations. Energetic “Hunter” type of commercial manager with “roll up sleeves” mentality. Excellent communication and people skills. A highly collaborative, enthusiastic manager with a proven track record of working in matrix organizations. History of setting and achieving high standards of performance. Values and leverages diversity. Strong character and personal integrity. Attitude of “putting the customer in the heart of everything we do”.

General Function: The Video Production Assistant is responsible for shooting and editing of corporate/personal branding videos for live events and recorded events for Anolbe Pte Ltd, its business associates and clients; creating promotional videos with story themes for an exciting video marketing campaign, as well as streaming global and national live events. Professional Support: The successful candidate will be briefed on the nature of the events and the required shots to be captured and edited. He/she will also be mentored by the Marketing Director who would give coaching and feedback to the candidate’s work performance. Requested Time Commitment: This is a temporary freelance position whereby the candidate has the opportunity to become a full time staff, if the candidate's work performance is found to be exemplary. The successful candidate would be required to start work in March/April 2022. Duties: 1. Shoot and record live events e.g. speaking workshops/seminars/trade exhibition (subject to the government measures on safe distancing). 2. Shoot and produce interview videos for personal branding and marketing purposes. 3. Assist the Marketing Director to create compelling videos and video ads with storylines using the right mix of music, footages and special effects together. 4. Edit videos for all company-related events/projects to deliver to client’s expectations. 5. Occasional streaming of live events on multiple online meeting platforms to social media. Pre-requisites: 1. Knowledge of basic video production. 2. Knowledge and experience in using UHD 4K digital video cameras, including SLR digital cameras. 3. Working knowledge of either one/or all of these editing software: Apple iMovie, Apple Final Cut Pro, Adobe Premier Pro, Adobe Premier Elements. 4. Experience and creativity in video editing to meet the clients’ expectations. 5. Independent worker with strong work ethic. 6. Able to handle the pressure of delivering results within tight timelines. 7. A good team player committed to fulfil company goals. Benefits to Video Production Assistant 1.Gain experience in professional video production. This includes multi-camera set-up; the use of story-telling to bring out a message to target audiences in a video; location and interview shoots; handling of audio mixing and subtitles; and post-production editing. 2.Skills development in the whole process of video production for the candidate to be positioned for the role of a director of photography. This includes pre-production planning, set up of camera and lighting position, executing the actual shoot, directing the cast as well as post production work like footage and sound editing. 3.To prepare the candidate to work in a multi-disciplinary digital media industry. The candidate will learn to be nimble in meeting the versatile needs of clients for marketing campaigns, personal branding and creating public awareness for video creation within tight timelines.

Workplace Options is seeking a qualified Full-time EAP Clinical Counsellor to join our clinical team in Singapore . Our clinical department provides counselling services on a global scale including but not limited to clinical telephonic support, structured short-term solution-focussed counselling, crisis support, psychoeducational workshops and trainings. Responsibilities: Provide telephonic counselling, in-the-moment support and crisis telephonic management in a supportive, ethical and professional manner while maintaining client-confidentiality. Adhere to the ethical, therapeutic and legal standards, which govern service delivery, as well as policies, procedures and laws, which apply to the organization and country, as appropriate. Maintain clear clinical and task-oriented documentation in case management system. Possess genuine listening skills and can provide short-term clinical interventions such as CBT, Motivational Interviewing and Solution-Focused Brief Therapy techniques. Ability to work with clients presenting with substance abuse, situations of crisis, mental health symptoms and/or family/relationship-related concerns impacting personal or work performance. Assess clients thoroughly to ensure clinical appropriateness of short-term counselling. Flexibility with regards to schedule with a need to cover some bank holidays and weekends. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed in this role and therefore, this employee will be required to follow any other functional-related instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisor. Requirements: Master’s Degree in Counselling, Psychology or similar. Full member of Singapore Psychological Society, Singapore Association for Counselling, Singapore Association of Social Workers or its equivalent. Member of the Singapore Registrar of Psychologists, with eligibility for registration or its equivalent. Minimum two years post-masters’ direct client-contact experience or 500 hours of direct client contact hours. Effectively bilingual having excellent command of English both in speech and writing. Ability to work well under pressure. Excellent IT and administration skills. Additional crisis support, coaching and/or training experience/qualifications an advantage. Ability to work weekends an advantage. Recommended Skills Active Listening Administration Case Management Systems Clinical Works Coaching And Mentoring Confidentiality

Location: Funan, 107, North Bridge Road, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179105, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description At Paragon, we are much more than just a karate school, a sport, or a fun activity. We are a family that creates Superheroes. Our Australian School is growing, and we are looking for young, energetic, enthusiastic and passionate individuals to join us as we expand into Singapore. We teach our students that they can positively influence the world by focusing on their behaviour. Through our innovative programs, each of our students learns to unleash their inner Superhero to become the best version of themselves that they can be. At Paragon, we aim to make each class a positive, rewarding and motivating experience. We are a family school with a friendly, inclusive and welcoming community, providing exceptional karate training to students of all ages, backgrounds, and abilities. Regardless of ability, we believe that any person should be given the opportunity to participate fully, and our programs are designed to ensure this. ParagonInc Singapore's expansion has the primary objective of opening a SuperHero School in Singapore focused on a Martial Arts program for children aged 5-11. In addition, we will expand into teenager, adults, and pre-school aged children post the initial launch. We are looking for instructors to join us on this journey from the beginning! The offer: We are holding a comprehensive selection activity starting March 1st 2022, for two months. 8-10 candidates will be selected to join this selection activity. Candidates will receive two months of free training to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts. Following this, we will select 3-4 instructors for paid positions. - Join two months of free lessons (twice a week) to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts (March 1st to April 30th). - After two months, the head instructor will select Instructors to become part of the Paragon Instructor Team in a paid position. - If you are not selected as an instructor in the first two months, you are welcome to continue training with us at a reduced fee rate. Ongoing benefits: - Instructors will continue to receive free martial arts training. - Opportunities to travel to our sister school in Australia Applicants can be current university students, new graduates or mid-career. The successful applicant will be able to provide evidence of working with children and (preferably) martial arts. Overall Purpose and Objective of This Position: The Instructor positions at Paragon Martial Arts are a critical role responsible for maximizing the experience that all students have in class and with our School and ensuring the students learn the curriculum and see positive changes in their lives. This includes teaching class, leading by example and ensuring the space at Paragon Martial Arts reflects the high standards we demand of our School. Roles and Responsibilities: Leading Class – Instructors must be capable of leading a class (you will be trained in all aspects of Martial Arts required). This involves following the curriculum plan and designing and implementing fun and engaging classes that help every student make progress towards their goals. To do this, the Instructor must understand each student's individual goals. Student engagement – The number one role of an instructor is to ensure that every student in a class is actively engaged in the class and that classes are exciting. This should be done through frequent minor adjustments in behaviour through positive means. Every student and person who walks into our School should be made to feel like they are a valued member of our community, of our tight family. You will also be required to run specific drills explained to you by the Instructor. Cleaning – As part of providing our students and families with an experience that surpasses all expectations, it is important that the environment we train in is kept Super clean. Keeping the School clean is the job of every Paragon employee. Leading by example – You must maintain the standard of a superhero both in and outside of karate. You must maintain a minimum of two classes per week of training. You will be asked to hold yourself to a higher standard than others would. Any public social profiles or private ones that have any members of Paragon Martial Arts on them must be maintained at a standard acceptable of someone working with children, for example, no swearing, drunken photos, racist comments or anything demeaning to anyone. Anything that would lower our families' impression of you or the School should be avoided. Student Retention – An essential component of an Instructors role is ensuring all students are continually improving. You will also be involved in helping create a strong relationship between the student and Paragon Martial Arts. You will need to get to know all of our students remembering names is an absolute must. You will also be required to write at least one Great Job card per night of teaching. Sales – As a member of the Paragon Team, it is expected that you will assist with bringing in new students. This may be by referring new students, talking about our programs to people, or helping with getting advertising material out. You will also be required to do basic cash register activities selling uniforms, merchandise and events. You are also expected to interact with Paragon posts through social media and help share the message with your social circle. Expectations: The Instructor is expected at all times to: 1. Lead by example 2. Train minimum two times per week 3. Attend all instructor training sessions 4. Maintain excellent knowledge of the curriculum they have covered. 5. Be punctual on all commitments 6. Conduct themselves with a highly positive, energetic and contagious attitude 7. Be constantly adding value to the student experience 8. Raise the quality of instruction at Paragon Martial Arts 9. Be Punctual to all commitments 10. Maintain a high energy high expectations class. 11. Follow up with the manager or the family on any students missing class 12. Maintain student numbers in class 13. Bring in a minimum of 2 new students per month Characteristics and Skills Sets: 1. Strong and positive attitude 2. Hunger to learn 3. Energetic 4. Martial Arts Interest 5. Ability to interact and talk to children 6. Ability to interact and talk to families 7. Desire to do more than is expected 8. Strong teaching skills with a desire to continually learn how to improve 9. Ability to deliver the curriculum in an exciting manner Reporting Channel: The Instructor reports to the Director of ParagonInc Please apply now if you would like to be considered for the selection process. Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

This role primarily supports SEA financial forecast and Business Finance activities. The role also supports regional CSBG SOX controls & coordination. Develop, analyze and business partnering with operations to present financial information in a timely manner to enable decision making and meeting the financial accountability of the organization to various stakeholders. The SG Tax Compliance Manager will be responsible for all aspects of Tax Compliance & reporting for Lam Research Singapore, Lam Research Malaysia including Indirect Taxes (GST) for three entities, in particular the Singapore GST Compliance of the Lam Research International Sdn Bhd. Whilst focus is on GST compliance, the role will also support Corporate Tax reporting, Withholding Tax reporting, Transfer Price matters of Lam Research Singapore, Lam Research Malaysia. This position will report to the Singapore Regional Controller. Responsible for the management of Singapore GST compliance, monitoring and reporting of the Lam Research International Sdn Bhd under the IRAS Assisted Compliance Assurance Programme (ACAP) certification. GST Compliance management & drive initiatives for relevant entity to avoid non-recoverable GST, where applicable. Drive and manage all tax queries & audit for the 3 entities in the relevant aspects. Direct liaison with local Tax consultant on all tax matters. Manage preparation of Singapore income tax returns and indirect tax reporting. Manage reporting of Withholding tax relating to Singapore & Malaysia entities and business operations. Liaise with Corporate Tax teams on regular requests, and to manage any change in Transfer pricing directions, as guided by Corporate Tax.

Zuellig Pharma (ZP) is one of the largest healthcare services groups in Asia and our purpose is to make healthcare more accessible. Zuellig Pharma is the leading provider of distribution services to manufacturers in the life science industry in the Asia Pacific region. With operations in 13 countries or territories Zuellig Pharma has strong market positions, critical mass, broad geographic coverage, and significant potential for continuing growth. We are currently looking for a Full Stack Engineer to join our team. This is a replacement position based in Singapore within the Digital and Data function. The candidate will be joining a new start-up funded by Zuellig Pharma. This business will be focused on the development of a ground-breaking new Blockchain Solution in Pharma Supply Chain. The solution aims to create unprecedented traceability and visibility for products flowing through the pharma supply chain while also empowering patients and healthcare practitioners to identify counterfeit products in the market. The business is in its infancy but has just received funding to grow and we are looking for skilled and motivated individuals to help us accelerate and scale Our Full Stack Developers will be the bedrock of the eZTracker organization and will be responsible for driving and executing on all technology related elements of the business. This will include building and managing the overall product architecture and features / feature roadmap. He/she must have strong, hands-on work experience in building web applications using modern development frameworks and in cloud environment – with familiarity across both back-end and DevOps tasks and activities. Additionally, applicants will benefit from having an understanding in blockchain networks and solution design – specifically in Hyperledger – although this is not a necessary pre-requisite. Responsibilities Participate in product development discussions on feature road map and future releases Drive the feature development of the overall blockchain product by designing and building web server, middleware, blockchain network and architecture. Operate as part of a team of experienced developers – work collaboratively and in coordination with the team to deliver on the overall technology agenda of the product. Work in the delivery team with Backend Developer and Test Engineer to plan and execute product and project infra. Design, deliver and maintain production level architecture and infra in cloud environment to support big volume data and concurrency. Build and maintain health monitoring mechanism in production environment, debug, troubleshoot and fix issues. Ensure task and ticket delivery on time, with quality and in full. Manage maintenance and optimization of the product, including deployment of feature releases, working in tandem with / managing a team of offshore contractors. Manage workflow to contract developers. Main Challenges Operate in a fast paced and fast-moving environment Deal with complex user requirements Stay up to date and familiar with Blockchain methodologies and concepts Comfortable in a multi-cultural and unstructured environment Requirements Bachelor’s Degree with 2-4 years of relevant experience Knowledge in Computer Science, App Development (Web) and DevOps Experience in Agile Methodology, Blockchain and Technology Architecture will be advantageous Strong programming skills, solid data structure and algorithm fundamentals. Deep technical understanding of scalability, resilience, high availability and the corresponding architecture, technology, and design with distributed systems. Proven expertise in Java language and Java ecosystem and used frameworks like SpringBoot where you applied in web side application development. Experience in developing mobile applications with Reactive Native & Reactive JS or Object-C & Swift language in iOS Hands-on experience in DevOps/ Currently practicing DevOps methodology. Proven experience with Azure or other public cloud services and related cloud technologies. Experience in containerization and orchestration technologies like Docker and Kubernetes in both development and production environments. Hands-on experiences in Linux script or any one of Shell, Perl, Python, go, etc. Experience administering and deploying development CI/CD tools such as GitHub, Jira, CircleCi / Jenkins, Jfrog, SonarQube, etc. Proven experience with log monitoring, collection, and analysis. Proven experience with cloud and infra monitors practice and tools, such as AppDynamics, Prometheus, etc. Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills. Front-end experience, including mobile development, is highly preferrable Experience working with remote teams is highly preferrable. Strong communication skills and sensitive to different requirements. All successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Position Summary: The incumbent identifies business trends and marketing opportunities that can improve hotel's performance. Eesponsible for assigned sales target in accordance to cluster segmentation, to work closely with each salesperson to identify opportunities and ways to maximize and exceed personal and team revenue goals. Job Description: Business Development Identify business trends and marketing opportunities that can improve the hotel’s performance. Continuously solicit for new business that expands our client base using action plans focused on the market segment identified by the Director of Sales. Prospecting and growing an account list, handling incoming leads and closing sales. Plan, execute and follow-up on sales trips as approved. Work closely with other sales associates and calling in on important customers and establishing multiple levels of contacts within the customer’s organisation. Participate in the sales meetings by sharing latest market trends and new business development opportunities and activities. Attend tradeshows, travel functions, major business functions or as required/directed by the Director of Sales. Organizes familiarization of hotels and their facilities with clients and potential ones. General Support and assist in the development of the annual Business Plan, Hotel Budget and Marketing Plan as requested by the Director of Sales. Create excellent client relationship through attention to detail; prompt follow up and empathy for customer perceptions and needs whilst maintaining professionalism. Prepare periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion. Take ownership of daily sales activities and maximize the productivity by following a system of weekly and monthly action plans. Demonstrate good working relationship with other departments maintaining effective communication and teamwork. Actively assist the Credit Department in follow-up of overdue accounts. Complete small administrative tasks on your own (i.e., photocopying, filing) where possible. Possess a commitment to the quality of all departmental records (i.e., computerised mailing list) which impacts the workload of support associates. Comprehend, digest and comply to hotel policies and procedure as described in the Associate Handbook and other documents Support and uphold the Hotel’s Mission, Vision and guiding principles. Adhere to all established policies and procedures relating to administration of accounts and ultimate booking of business. Other duties assigned by the Director of Sales when required from time to time. Talent Profile: Minimum 5 years progressive experience in a proactive Sales Role in an established luxury hotels with large meeting spaces. Proven track records of achieving revenue in 4 to 5-Star Hotel under MICE sales. Minimum Diploma in Hospitality/Tourism/Hotel Management or equivalent. Driven, self-motivated individual with excellent interpersonal, spoken and written communication skills. An excellent team player who is able to work under pressure and meeting tight deadlines.

Job_Title: Consumer Insights and Market Research, Assistant Manager
Job_Descriptions: Main duties: Create research proposal to outline recommended research plan design, specific methodologies, schedule, and budget; create survey questionnaires or discussion guides, analysis/tabulation plans and quality control. Coordinate full life cycle research ensuring quality, timeliness, scheduling, programming/fielding, data processing and reporting. Manage the design and execution of research projects; effectively share results to facilitate data-driven decision making. Prepare reactive & proactive global & regional/local presentations and communicate findings (with recommendations) to internal business units/cross functional departments. Work closely with various departments to understand knowledge gaps across the business and use insights to drive strategy; utilize an understanding of previously conducted research and learnings to recognize potential gaps and leverage existing insights as possible for future needs. Start customer engagement; listen to business needs and be able to support and identify opportunities based on insights. Drive awareness and use of consumer insights throughout the organization, fuelling and supporting consumer-centric culture. Serve as mentor to junior researchers, share existing knowledge and experience, leverage expertise to guide or direct junior researchers. Investigate and select vendors via RFP process for each research project to ensure quality research deliverables, manage vendor partners to ensure work is high quality, on time, and within budget. Partner cross functionally to understand business needs and what research needs to be done to address current and future needs; Match research to internal/external client needs to gain stakeholder alignment on scope, offer up strategic approaches customized to business objectives. Provide support to maintain an effective database system for all market research studies and information. Report on all assigned project status and progress monthly to CIMR Lead Job requirements: Degree with minimum 7 years of working experience in Market Research (or 5 years in the Fragrance industry or from similar industry is an added advantage Good project management skills; analytical skills and numbers savvy Cultural savvy, demonstrates understanding of differences among countries and cultures Thinks outside the box regarding insights and research approaches and methods Ability to distil disparate data into compelling insights and deliver story driven reporting and call-to-action for the business Excellent communication and presentation skills Able to work independently with minimum supervision Team player with good interpersonal skills (strong collaborator who can work effectively in a cross functional team, ability to partner closely using insights to influence and drive business strategic decisions) Proficient in English both oral and written Knowledge of statistical software (XLSTAT, SPSS and other related statistical software) If you are interested in the above position and your profile corresponds to the above requirements, you are invited to apply by sending a detail resume, stating current and expected salaries as well as notice period to *********@takasago.com. Please quote the position you are applying for. We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Senior Regional IT Lead / IT / Healthcare / Up to SGD 5,500/mth!
Job_Descriptions: My client a leading international healthcare company is looking out for a Senior Regional IT Lead to lead and manage their IT related matters and projects across the region. ClearSK Healthcare Pte Ltd manages the award-winning ClearSK® chain of medi-aesthetics clinics island-wide and overseas branches in Shanghai & Hangzhou. As a Singapore leading aesthetics chain, it will be a great opportunity for you to grow and learn in a multi-disciplinary environment with medical and management professionals. You will find yourself working in a challenging environment, where your capabilities will be developed to the max. We are seeking an experienced Clinical Operations professional (experienced in healthcare, wellness and hospitality industry preferred) with an entrepreneur spirit, energetic, hands-on fast learner who works well under pressure. Career development prospect is very good for candidates who are F.I.T - Fast, Inquisitive and Trainable to fill the position of Operation Manager for ClearSK Healthcare, As Operation Manager of ClearSK Healthcare, you will serve a key role for the organization as a leader, with responsibilities to problem solve and implement processes to provide the highest quality of care to our clients. You are both an organised person, a systematic thinker and a diligent doer who love to systematically execute business plans, organise logistics and manpower to achieve business outcomes. Job Description • Manage day-to-day branch operations and sales for multiple centres. • Manage an admin team to handle invoicing and operations audit. • Motivate and manage a team of consultants and therapists to achieve their goals. • Work closely with the call centre and customer service team • Ensure a high level of service quality and total customer satisfaction. • Work closely with the Marketing Department on the execution of sales and promotional activities. • Handle customers’ feedback and provide service recovery where necessary. • Evaluate staff performance, provide feedback and coaching. • Ensure branch staff follows policies, procedures and processes. • Other operational and ad-hoc duties assigned Requirement • The suitable candidate should possess Advanced Graduate Diploma, Bachelor’s Degree / Post-Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in any field (Para-medical or nursing is preferred) • Previous work experience in mid-luxury to luxury day/international spas or aesthetic clinics will be an asset. • At least 3 years of relevant supervisory/managerial level experience in the beauty/spa industry. Those who possess Paramedical diploma may apply. • Able to lead and mentor a team. • Good communications and strong interpersonal skills. • Result driven and service oriented. • Strong aptitude in promotional techniques – without hard selling • English, Mandarin (in order to handle customers’ feedback and to build and establish relationship with English and Mandarin speaking customers.) Rewards & Benefits 5-day work week (alternate Sat) Medical & Dental Benefits Monthly Performance Bonus Reward and recognition program that appreciate the most competent and capable Exclusive staff discounts on our products and services

COMPANY DESCRIPTION Established in 1948, YHI was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited (SGX-ST) on 3rd July 2003.  YHI Group is a recognized distributor of high quality automotive and industrial products, and a familiar and trusted name in alloy wheels manufacturing as an Original Design Manufacturer (ODM). Today, YHI’s wide international presence can be seen in over 100 countries operating through its 32 subsidiaries and two associated companies located in Asia Pacific, North America and Europe.  YHI distributes a diverse range of premium automotive products, which include tyres, alloy wheels, energy solutions, buggy & utilities vehicles and other industrial products to more than 5,000 customers globally.  YHI currently has three alloy wheels manufacturing plants located in Suzhou in China, Taoyuan in Taiwan and Malacca in Malaysia. In order to strengthen YHI distribution network, the Group will continuously sharpen its sales focus, as well as embark on strategic plans to promote and develop its portfolio of premium and proprietary brands in the global market where "The World is Our Market". In line with YHI expansion plans, it is now seeking for individuals who share its core values and ethics and willing to grow together. Similarly, candidates will be promised a warm & caring environment and a platform to grow professionally. RESPONSIBILITIES The successful candidate will supervise the Finance team to ensure the smooth running of the day-to-day operations. Main duties include: Responsible for monthly, quarterly and yearly financial reporting, cash-flow planning and operating cost analysis Responsible for monthly management reporting, including performance by Business Units (with analysis of expenses and profitability) Analyse and interpret financial data and recommend changes to improve financial performance Align and improve the internal control according to the Group's Financial and Internal Control Policies and Procedures Ensure year-end audit is completed within deadlines, liaise and maintain good working relationships with external auditors, tax agent and bankers Attend to the needs of the Business Units on operational issues which are Finance related Oversee the accounts receivable and stockholdings status and highlight to Management/Business Units on critical matters Oversee the credit control function and forex matters including hedging of foreign currencies Responsible for the preparation of annual budgets and periodic forecast Responsible for leading the annual stocktake exercise Oversee the non-staff related insurance policy matters Initiate modifications/enhancements to the computerised systems and accounting procedures to increase efficiency and control QUALIFICATIONS University Degree in Accountancy or professional qualification in Accounting, preferably a CA Preferred relevant experience with knowledge of SAP accounting system Pro-active in providing advice/value add to the Business Units on financial data, costs, inventory and accounts receivable matters Positive attitude with the desire to change for the better OTHER INFORMATION Working Hours: 8.30am to 6.09pm (Mon – Fri) Company transport pickup at Clementi MRT (One Way) Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - YHI Corporation (Singapore) Pte Ltd

About Us We are a global leader in financial services, providing strategic financial advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, individuals and investors. Our first-class business is inherently a best in class way approach to serving clients that drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their financial objectives. We serve clients’ future planning needs via quality financial advice and innovative solutions. By listening to our clients, we have created comprehensive solutions that have catered to their evolving requirements over the past 100+ years. Our top priority is to educate and secure clients with the financial certainty that ensures peace of mind by creating safety nets for unforeseen circumstances in the near and long term. Job Responsibilities If you are someone who is confident and able to leverage current skills as well as the robust training we will provide for your professional readiness, go ahead and apply. You will build and manage a growing portfolio of clients supported by a multinational financial solutions company in Singapore. We expect you to deliver on the following 8 A’s : o Actively source and manage clients (B2C and B2B) to build a customer portfolio, expand your prospect pipeline o Advise clients on avenues for wealth accumulation, risk protection and savings growth o Address clients’ objectives by curating solutions from our product suite o Achieve meaningful client relationships based on trust o Associate with people from diverse industries o Assist clients' with evolving future proofing needs o Attend trainings and workshops, develop both product and soft skills o Analyze competitive products, leveraging our competitive advantage as an industry leader Benefits o Competitive remuneration package with performance linked incentives o Quarterly bonuses o Overseas travel (post COVID) o Fun working environment o Work-life Balance o Professional training and Career growth opportunities o Skills development workshops and mentorship o Performance recognition in the form of Global awards o Opportunity to build and lead a team Requirements o Bachelor’s Degree in Singapore or overseas equivalent in any field o People-oriented, growth mindset with good interpersonal skills o Resourceful, independent, open to learning and self-driven Our Culture We recognize our people are our strength and the diverse talent they bring to our workforce directly links to our continued success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We provide a flexible and motivating workplace for our people that starts with a professional on-boarding experience and training program. We take pride in investing in our employees and enable them to succeed. You will have the opportunity to maintain a positive work-life balance while delivering on your goals and meeting KPIs. We encourage our employees to leverage career growth opportunities by developing their professional and leadership skills.
